entry.name: ocspbadresponsetype
entry.text: Unrecognized OCSP response type
entry.description: The OCSP responder returned a response whose type is unsupported. Only the OCSP basic response is supported.

entry.name: ocspbadsig
entry.text: OCSP response signature did not verify
entry.description: The digital signature on the OCSP response message could not be verified. This may indicate an error in the OCSP responder or an attempt to modify the OCSP response in transit.

entry.name: ocspmissingaia
entry.text: X.509v3 Authority Information Access extension not found for OCSP
entry.description: The URL argument of the dp:ocsp-validate-certificate() extension function was '%aia%' but there was no Authority Information Access extension found in the certificate to be validated. When the certificate to be validated lacks the AIA extension, the caller of dp:ocsp-validate-certificate() must provide the location of the OCSP responder in the URL argument (instead of using the default value of '%aia%').

entry.name: ocspnoncemismatch
entry.text: OCSP response nonce did not match request nonce
entry.description: The OCSP responder included a nonce in its response that did not match the nonce in the OCSP request. This may indicate an error in the OCSP responder or an attempt to modify the communication between the system and the OCSP responder.

entry.name: ocsprespcertnotfound
entry.text: OCSP responder's certificate was not found
entry.description: The OCSP responder's X.509 certificate was not found in the crypto validation credentials provided to the OCSP extension function.

entry.name: ocsprespparsefailure

entry.name: pkcs7signzerolengthinput
entry.text: PKCS#7 sign error: zero length input document
entry.description: The input document to be signed is zero length. Make sure that the input document is in the specified "Input Encoding Format". In particular, if base64 encoded data is expected as the input and base64 data is not provided then the actual document to be signed may be zero length since it can't be base64 decoded.

entry.name: crl_notask
entry.text: Cannot spawn CRL cache task
entry.description: Certification revocation lists cannot be processed because of an unexpected internal error.
entry.suggestion: This is an internal error. Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: crl_http_hangup
entry.text: HTTP CRL source '%s' got hangup
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway established a connection with the Certificate Revocation List server via HTTP, but the server disconnected unexpectedly. If this happens all the time, it will prevent the DataPower Gateway from learning which certificates have been revoked. This may be caused by attempting to connect to the wrong URL, by a network error, or by some kind of CRL server misconfiguration or malfunction.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured server address, port, and URL for the named CRL source. Ensure robust network connectivity between the DataPower Gateway and the server. Attempt to connect to the URL using a web browser to retrieve the CRL.

entry.name: crl_delete
entry.text: Deleting CRL source '%s'
entry.description: The CRL source was deleted from configuration and will not be polled any longer.

entry.name: crl_ldap_error
entry.text: Error fetching CRL from LDAP source '%1$s': %2$s
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway established a connection with the Certificate Revocation List server via LDAP, but the server disconnected unexpectedly. If this happens all the time, it will prevent the DataPower Gateway from learning which certificates have been revoked. This may be caused by attempting to connect to the wrong address, using the wrong LDAP parameters, by a network error, or by some kind of LDAP CRL server misconfiguration or malfunction.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured server address, port, and LDAP parameters for the named CRL source. Ensure robust network connectivity between the DataPower Gateway and the server.

entry.name: crl_ldap_zeroattr
entry.text: LDAP CRL source '%1$s' returned an empty value for attribute '%2$s'
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway queries two LDAP attributes when fetching Certificate Revocation Lists via LDAP. This message indicates that one of those two attributes had an empty value and was ignored.
entry.suggestion: If both of the two LDAP attributes on a given LDAP CRL source return this error, then double-check the LDAP server to make sure that it actually contains CRL data.

entry.name: crl_ldap_valid
entry.text: Successfully fetched valid CRL from LDAP source '%s'
entry.description: A valid CRL was successfully fetched via LDAP.

entry.name: crl_invalid
entry.text: Invalid CRL from source '%1$s': %2$s
entry.description: The CRL from the specified source was invalid. Either it was malformed or its signature did not verify.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured CRL source including the validation credentials used to check its signature.

entry.name: crl_http_valid
entry.text: Successfully fetched valid CRL from HTTP source '%s'
entry.description: A valid CRL was successfully fetched via HTTP.

entry.name: crl_http_invalid_url
entry.text: Invalid URL '%1$s' in HTTP CRL source '%2$s': %3$s
entry.description: The URL for the specified HTTP CRL source was invalid.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured HTTP CRL source and make sure that it contains a valid URL.

entry.name: crl_http_read_error
entry.text: Error reading CRL from HTTP source '%1$s': %2$d
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway established a connection with the Certificate Revocation List server via HTTP, but there was an unexpected error while reading the response. If this happens all the time, it will prevent the DataPower Gateway from learning which certificates have been revoked. This may be caused by attempting to connect to the wrong URL, by a network error, or by some kind of CRL server misconfiguration or malfunction.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured server address, port, and URL for the named CRL source. Ensure robust network connectivity between the DataPower Gateway and the server. Attempt to connect to the URL using a web browser to retrieve the CRL.

entry.name: crl_too_long
entry.text: CRL from source '%1$s' is longer than %2$d byte max length
entry.description: The Certificate Revocation List from the specified source was too large to be processed.
entry.suggestion: Use a shorter Certificate Revocation List or use OCSP instead of CRLs.

entry.name: crl_oom
entry.text: Error allocating CRL buffer for source '%s'
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway ran out of memory trying to process the Certificate Revocation List from the specified source.
entry.suggestion: Use a shorter Certificate Revocation List.

entry.name: crl_http_error_cb
entry.text: Error fetching CRL from HTTP source '%s'
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway established a connection with the Certificate Revocation List server via HTTP, but there was an unexpected error while reading the response. If this happens all the time, it will prevent the DataPower Gateway from learning which certificates have been revoked. This may be caused by attempting to connect to the wrong URL, by a network error, or by some kind of CRL server misconfiguration or malfunction.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured server address, port, and URL for the named CRL source. Ensure robust network connectivity between the DataPower Gateway and the server. Attempt to connect to the URL using a web browser to retrieve the CRL.

entry.name: crl_http_error_connect
entry.text: Error fetching CRL from HTTP source '%s' during connect
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway could not connect to the Certificate Revocation List server via HTTP. If this happens all the time, it will prevent the DataPower Gateway from learning which certificates have been revoked. This may be caused by attempting to connect to the wrong URL, by a network error, or by some kind of CRL server misconfiguration or malfunction.
entry.suggestion: Double-check the configured server address, port, and URL for the named CRL source. Ensure robust network connectivity between the DataPower Gateway and the server. Attempt to connect to the URL using a web browser to retrieve the CRL.

entry.name: sslerrorstack
entry.text: error initializing TLS stack: %s
entry.description: This is an internal error initializing the TLS subsystem.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorcontext
entry.text: error creating server context for '%s'
entry.description: An internal error occurred when trying to initialize the TLS subsystem for an XML Firewall configured with a server crypto profile.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorinitrevprofile1
entry.text: error initializing reverse profile for '%s', identification credentials are required
entry.description: The TLS proxy profile includes a reverse (server) crypto profile, but the crypto profile does not specify a crypto identification credentials object.
entry.suggestion: Check the configuration of the TLS proxy profile, the reverse (server) crypto profile, and the crypto identification credentials. Ensure that all objects are configured and in the operational "up" state.

entry.name: sslerrorinitrevprofile2
entry.text: error initializing reverse profile for '%s'
entry.description: The TLS subsystem encountered an error during initialization for an XML Firewall that specifies a reverse (server) crypto profile.

entry.name: sslerrorinitrevprofileca
entry.text: error initializing client CA list in reverse profile for '%s'
entry.description: The XML firewall is configured with a reverse (server) crypto profile that specifies a client CA list. This causes TLS client authentication to occur. The TLS subsystem encountered an error initializing the client CA list.

entry.name: sslerrorserverprofileid
entry.text: error setting session ID context for server profile for '%s'
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while configuring the reverse (server) crypto profile for an XML Firewall.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorclientprofilectxtcreate
entry.text: error creating client context for '%s'
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while configuring the forward (client) crypto profile for an XML Firewall.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorclientprofilectxtinit
entry.text: error initializing forward profile for '%s'
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while configuring the forward (client) crypto profile for an XML Firewall.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerorsetcipher
entry.text: crypto profile '%s', unable to set cipher-list
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while creating the list of cipher algorithms.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorloadprivkey
entry.text: crypto profile '%s', could not load private key
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while loading the private key specified by the crypto identification credentials in the crypto profile.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorloadidcred
entry.text: crypto profile '%s', could not load identification certificate
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while loading the X.509 certificate specified by the crypto identification credentials in the crypto profile.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrornetworkread
entry.text: error reading from connection: %s
entry.description: The TLS subsystem encountered an unrecoverable error reading from the network during TLS negotiation with the peer.

entry.name: sslerrornetworkwrite
entry.text: error writing to connection: %s
entry.description: The TLS subsystem encountered an unrecoverable error writing to the network during TLS negotiation with the peer.

entry.name: sslerrorstartnegotiate
entry.text: cannot attach to stream
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while attempting to start an TLS protocol negotiation.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrornosslproxyprofile
entry.text: failed to accept, no TLS Proxy Profile provided
entry.description: The TLS subsystem attempted to accept a connection for an XML Firewall for which no TLS proxy profile is configured.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrordownsslproxyprofile
entry.text: failed to accept, TLS Proxy Profile '%s' is not up
entry.description: The TLS subsystem was unable to accept an incoming connection for the XML Firewall because the reverse (server) crypto profile specified by the TLS proxy profile is in the operational "down" state.
entry.suggestion: Check that the TLS proxy profile, the reverse (server) crypto profile, the crypto identification credentials, and any other referenced objects are in the operational "up" state.

entry.name: sslerrornosrvctxtsslproxyprofile
entry.text: failed to accept, TLS Proxy Profile '%s' has no server context
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while accepting an incoming TLS connection for an XML Firewall.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrorfailedtoattach
entry.text: failed to attach TLS to incoming connection
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while accepting an incoming TLS connection.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrornosslproxyprofileoutbound
entry.text: failed to connect, no TLS Proxy Profile provided
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while trying to initiate an outbound TLS connection.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sslerrordownsslproxyprofileoubound
entry.text: failed to connect, TLS Proxy Profile '%s' is not up
entry.description: The TLS subsystem was unable to establish an outbound TLS connection because the forward (client) crypto profile specified by the TLS proxy profile is in the operational "down" state.
entry.suggestion: Check that the TLS proxy profile, the reverse (server) crypto profile, the crypto identification credentials, and any other referenced objects are in the operational "up" state.

entry.name: sslerrornoctxtsslproxyprofileoutbound

entry.name: certmonenable

entry.suggestion: Follow the link to the Crypto Certificate Monitor to review configuration.

entry.name: certmondisable

entry.name: certmonbadnotafter

entry.name: certmondisabledcert
entry.text: Disabling certificate '%1$s' in domain '%2$s' because it expired at '%3$s'
entry.description: The Certificate Monitor disabled the specified certificate object because the certificate is expired and DisableExpiredCerts is enabled in the Certificate Monitor.
entry.suggestion: Find a more recent version of the specified certificate to replace the expired version.

entry.name: dpvc_onesubject
entry.text: only one 'subject' element allowed: %zd found
entry.description: The dp:validate-certificate extension function only supports one 'subject' element. Some caller violated this requirement.
entry.suggestion: Fix any XSLT you wrote that calls dp:validate-certificate so that it uses exactly one 'subject' element. If you did not write any such XSLT, contact IBM Support.

entry.name: dpvc_onepkipath
entry.text: only one 'pkipath' element allowed: %zd found
entry.description: The dp:validate-certificate extension function requires exactly one 'pkipath' element. Some caller violated this requirement.
entry.suggestion: Fix any XSLT you wrote that calls dp:validate-certificate so that it uses exactly one 'pkipath' element. If you did not write any such XSLT, contact IBM Support.

entry.name: dpvc_onepkcs7
entry.text: only one 'pkcs7' element allowed: %zd found
entry.description: The dp:validate-certificate extension function only supports one 'pkcs7' element. Some caller violated this requirement.
entry.suggestion: Fix any XSLT you wrote that calls dp:validate-certificate so that it uses exactly one 'pkcs7' element. If you did not write any such XSLT, contact IBM Support.

entry.name: dpvc_noarg
entry.text: exactly one of 'subject', 'pkipath', or 'pkcs7' element required: none found
entry.description: The dp:validate-certificate extension function requires exactly one of the following elements: 'subject', 'pkipath', or 'pkcs7'. Some caller violated this requirement.
entry.suggestion: Fix any XSLT you wrote that calls dp:validate-certificate so that it uses exactly one instance of one of the following elements: 'subject', 'pkipath', or 'pkcs7'. If you did not write any such XSLT, contact IBM Support.

entry.name: dpvc_b64
entry.text: could not base64 decode '%s' element
entry.description: The dp:validate-certificate extension function requires valid base64 encoded data inside any of the following elements: 'subject', 'ca', 'pkipath', or 'pkcs7'. Some caller violated this requirement by passing data that was not valid base64.

entry.name: dpvc_asn1
entry.text: could not ASN.1 parse '%s' element

entry.name: badsymkeylen
entry.text: *Invalid key length (%1$zu bytes) for algorithm '%2$.64s'*
entry.description: Each symmetric encryption algorithm requires keys of a specific length. A key of the wrong length was passed to a symmetric encryption extension function.
entry.suggestion: Correct any custom style sheets to use keys of the appropriate length for the given algorithm.

entry.name: badsymciphertext
entry.text: *Invalid ciphertext for algorithm '%.64s'*
entry.description: Decryption failed due to the ciphertext being invalid. Either the length was not valid for the given symmetric algorithm (due to not being a multiple of the block size), the padding was wrong, or the ciphertext did not contain the IV.
entry.suggestion: Confirm that the ciphertext has not been modified since its original creation.

entry.name: pkcs7_decrypt_one_fail
entry.text: PKCS#7 decrypt attempt failed using identification credentials '%s'
entry.description: Encrypted PKCS#7 messages can list multiple recipients (any one of which can decrypt the message). This message just indicates that trying to decrypt as the specified recipient failed. If decrypting as any one of the configured recipients works then the overall decrypt operation will succeed, so this message does not necessarily indicate a problem.

entry.name: unprotected_decrypt_key_error
entry.text: dp:decrypt-key() failed without Million Message Attack protection
entry.description: When using PKCS#1 as the RSA encryption algorithm dp:decrypt-key() has optional sixth and seventh arguments to enable and control protection against the Bleichenbacher Million Message Attack. In this case dp:decrypt-key() was called with the sixth argument set to false() (disabling this protection) and then it encountered a decryption failure. Decryption failures in dp:decrypt-data() with protection disabled allow the attack to be mounted. It is possible that someone is mounting the attack against the DataPower Gateway.
entry.suggestion: In order to enable protection against the Million Message Attack update any custom XSLT that calls dp:decrypt-key() with PKCS#1 to specify the optional sixth argument as true() and specify the symmetric encryption algorithm of the key that was encrypted as the seventh argument. Alternatively switch from RSA PKCS#1 to RSA OAEP (which is immune to this attack even without the protection arguments).

entry.name: cantverified
entry.text: *Signed value cannot be verified %s*

entry.name: ocsp_wrong_nresp
entry.text: Wrong number of individual responses (%d) in OCSP response
entry.description: An OCSP client can ask for information about multiple certificates in a single request (although this DataPower Gateway never does so). The server must include exactly one individual response for each of those certificates in its OCSP response. This error means that the server did not do this correctly.
entry.suggestion: This is a problem with the OCSP server (not the DataPower Gateway). Contact the administrator of the OCSP server.

entry.name: ocsp_wrong_certid
entry.text: OCSP response CertID did not match request CertID
entry.description: In an OCSP request there is an identifier called the CertID that is used to correlate information between the request and the response. This error message means that the server sent an OCSP response with a CertID that did not match the one in the request.
entry.suggestion: This is a problem with the OCSP server (not the DataPower Gateway). Contact the administrator of the OCSP server.

entry.name: ocsp_unknown_digest_alg
entry.text: OCSP response CertID used an unknown digest algorithm
entry.description: In its computation of a CertID in the OCSP response the OCSP server used a digest algorithm that is not supported by the DataPower Gateway.
entry.suggestion: Configure the OCSP server to use a digest algorithm that is supported by the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: decrypt_data_badctext
entry.text: *NULL decryption result*
entry.description: The ciphertext argument of dp:decrypt-data() was not valid. Its length may have been wrong for the algorithm, its padding bytes may have been invalid, or the resultant plaintext may have been invalid (in terms of character encoding).
entry.suggestion: Check that the data being sent to the decrypt action or to any custom call to dp:decrypt-data() is a valid ciphertext.

entry.name: decrypt_data_badptext
entry.text: Invalid plaintext character for character encoding '%s' in dp:decrypt-data()
entry.description: Before returning its plaintext result dp:decrypt-data() checks the characters in that plaintext for validity in terms of character encoding. This message means that the check failed and that dp:decrypt-data() returned an error because of it.
entry.suggestion: Check that the data being sent to the decrypt action or to any custom call to dp:decrypt-data() is an encryption of data that is valid in the given character encoding.

entry.suggestion: Check that the TLS Proxy Profile name that is passed to your custom XSLT refers to an TLS Proxy Profile that is already configured and is currently up.

entry.name: generic_expired_saml
entry.text: The SAML assertion has expired.

entry.name: legacy_ssl_server_connection_disabled
entry.text: The connection to a legacy TLS server is not allowed by the TLS Proxy Proxy, which impacts only when that TLS server is vulnerable to CVE-2009-3555.
entry.description: When the DataPower Gateway works as a TLS client, the renegotiation between a TLS server that uses a legacy protocol older than RFC 5746 is vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle attack (CVE-2009-3555). In such attack, the TLS client may not receive the server's renegotiation request at all, so both the initial connection and renegotiation to a legacy server both are not secure as expected, and both are disabled by the setting as configured in the TLS Proxy Proxy object. If the TLS server has supported RFC 5746, the renegotiation is not vulnerable as that TLS server is not a legacy server, the setting does not impact those TLS servers, thus the secure renegotiation are still enabled.
entry.suggestion: If such connection is needed temporarily before the TLS server is patched, change the TLS Proxy Proxy "Permit Connections to Insecure TLS Servers" to 'on'.

entry.name: legacy_ssl_server_connection_enabled
entry.text: The connection to a legacy TLS server is allowed by the TLS Proxy Proxy, which impacts only when that TLS server is vulnerable to CVE-2009-3555.
entry.description: When the DataPower Gateway works as a TLS client, the renegotiation between a TLS server that uses a legacy protocol older than RFC 5746 is vulnerable to a man-in-the-middle attack (CVE-2009-3555). In such attack, the TLS client may not receive the server's renegotiation request at all, so both the initial connection and renegotiation to a legacy server both are not secure as expected, but both are enabled by the setting as configured in the TLS Proxy Proxy object. If the TLS server has supported RFC 5746, the renegotiation is not vulnerable as that TLS server is not a legacy server, the setting does not impact those TLS servers, thus the secure renegotiation are still enabled.
entry.suggestion: Recommend to disable the connection to the vulnerable servers.

entry.name: invalid_utf8_found
entry.text: *Invalid UTF8 character is found.*
entry.description: The data contains invalid UTF8 characters that can not output to XML.
entry.suggestion: Check the data source and correct the invalid UTF8 character.

entry.name: encryption_token_problem
entry.text: Required encryption token is missing or invalid: expression %s
entry.description: Message is rejected by policy due to problem with encryption token.
entry.suggestion: Check to make sure the message is conformed to the Security Policy configured for the operation.

entry.name: authinfo_transcoded
entry.text: Authentication information transcoded from %s to UTF-8.
entry.description: Authentication information for the request we successfully transcoded to UTF-8.

entry.name: authinfo_invalid_char
entry.text: Error processing authentication information: Invalid %s character found
entry.description: The basic authentication credentials processed by AAA or dp:auth-info() contains an invalid characer for the specified encoding.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the basic authentication credentials passed by the client are encoded in the character set specified for the service.

entry.name: authinfo_transcoding_failed
entry.text: Error processing authentication information: Transcoding from %s to UTF-8 failed
entry.description: An error occured while transcoding.

entry.name: sign_entire_headers_and_body
entry.text: Message, with uri %s, violates OnlySignEntireHeadersAndBody assertion
entry.description: An error occured while validating WS-Security Policy.

entry.name: message_encrypted
entry.text: Message is encrypted.
entry.description: Message is encrypted, and this causes an undeterministric result with the validation.

entry.name: unsupported_cpoption_bits
entry.text: Unsupported bits in Crypto Profile options field: 0x%lx
entry.description: The bits in question were ignored when configuring the Crypto Profile as they were not supported.
entry.suggestion: Remove unsupported bits from the configuration.

entry.name: extfunc_options_xpath_failed
entry.text: %s: 'options' element not present in extension function argument
entry.description: Various cryptographic extension functions take an optional nodeset argument that is supposed to be of size one containing one element called 'options'. This error indicates that this requirement was not met.
entry.suggestion: Fix the XSLT that is calling the extension function in question so that it passes the correct nodeset value for the argument in question.

entry.name: extfunc_options_nscount
entry.text: %1$s: wrong number of 'options' elements (%2$d found; exactly 1 required)
entry.description: Various cryptographic extension functions take an optional nodeset argument that is supposed to be of size one containing one element called 'options'. This error indicates that this requirement was not met.
entry.suggestion: Fix the XSLT that is calling the extension function in question so that it passes the correct nodeset value for the argument in question.

entry.name: extfunc_options_bad_attr_value
entry.text: %1$s: invalid value '%2$.64s' for 'options' attribute '%3$s'
entry.description: Various cryptographic extension functions take an optional nodeset argument whose attributes can be used to control the function behavior. This error indicates that one of those attributes contained an invalid value.
entry.suggestion: Fix the XSLT that is calling the extension function in question so that it passes valid attributes values in the 'options' argument.

entry.name: radius_opstate_down
entry.text: Unable to do RADIUS authentication: RADIUS Settings object is down
entry.description: RADIUS authentication will never succeed unless the RADIUS Settings config object is opstate up.
entry.suggestion: Switch to Permissive crypto mode if the DataPower Gateway is in another crypto mode that bans MD5. MD5 is required by the RADIUS protocol.

entry.name: md5user_prevented_crypto_mode
entry.text: Unable to enter FIPS crypto mode due to local user %s with md5crypt password file entry
entry.description: FIPS mode does not allow the use of MD5, so if any user's password file entry uses md5crypt, the DataPower Gateway will refuse to enter FIPS mode.
entry.suggestion: Change the RBM settings to use sha256crypt and then change this user's password. You can also switch to Permissive crypto mode that allows the use of MD5.

entry.name: banned_hash_algorithm
entry.text: *Banned hash algorithm '%1$.128s' in extension function %2$s*
entry.description: Certain algorithms, like MD5, are banned in certain crypto modes, like FIPS 140-2 Level 1 mode. The extension function in question failed because the call involved a banned algorithm in the current crypto mode.
entry.suggestion: Switch to Permissive crypto mode or switch to using an algorithm that is not banned in the current crypto mode.

entry.name: c14n_error
entry.text: *XML canonicalization error in extension function %s*
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: ckey_file_banned_algorithm
entry.text: Crypto Key encrypted using banned algorithm and cannot be decrypted
entry.description: This Crypto Key object points at a file that is encrypted using an algorithm (like RC2) that is banned in the current crypto mode (probably FIPS 140-2 Level 1 mode). The Crypto Key is opstate down due to this.
entry.suggestion: Use a different Crypto Key file that is not encrypted using a banned algorithm or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: ckey_too_weak
entry.text: Crypto Key is too weak (< 1024 bits (DSA or RSA), < 256 bits (ECDSA)) for current crypto mode
entry.description: This Crypto Key object contains a DSA, RSA, or ECDSA key that is too weak for the current crypto mode. FIPS 140-2 requires RSA and DSA keys to be at least 1024 bits, and ECDSA keys to be equivalent to at least 256 bits.
entry.suggestion: Use a Crypto Key of at least 1024 bits (DSA or RSA) or equivalent to at least 256 bits (ECDSA), or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: ccert_file_banned_algorithm
entry.text: Crypto Certificate encrypted using banned algorithm and cannot be decrypted
entry.description: This Crypto Certificate object points at a file that is encrypted using an algorithm (like RC2) that is banned in the current crypto mode (probably FIPS 140-2 Level 1 mode). This causes the Crypto Certificate to be opstate down.
entry.suggestion: Use a different Crypto Certificate file that is encrypted using a supported algorithm in the current crypto mode or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: ccert_too_weak
entry.text: Crypto Certificate is too weak (< 1024 bits) for current crypto mode
entry.description: This Crypto Certificate object contains a DSA key or an RSA key that is too weak for the current crypto mode. FIPS 140-2 requires RSA and DSA keys to be at least 1024 bits.
entry.suggestion: Use a Crypto Certificate of at least 1024 bits or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: bad_oaep_param_dec
entry.text: *RSA OAEP decryption failed due to non-empty parameter*
entry.description: The FIPS 140-2 Level 1 crypto mode only contains partial support for OAEP. It only supports SHA-1 digest algorithm with an empty parameter string. This RSA OAEP decryption failed because it involved a non-empty parameter string and the DataPower Gateway is in FIPS mode. The Permissive crypto mode does not have these restrictions on its OAEP support.
entry.suggestion: Use zero length OAEP parameters with SHA-1 digest algorithm or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: bad_oaep_digest_dec
entry.text: *RSA OAEP decryption failed due to digest algorithm %s*
entry.description: The FIPS 140-2 Level 1 crypto mode only contains partial support for OAEP. It only supports SHA-1 digest algorithm with an empty parameter string. This RSA OAEP decryption failed because it involved a digest algorithm other than SHA-1 and the DataPower Gateway is in FIPS mode. The Permissive crypto mode does not have these restrictions on its OAEP support.
entry.suggestion: Use zero length OAEP parameters with SHA-1 digest algorithm or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: bad_oaep_param_enc
entry.text: *RSA OAEP encryption failed due to non-empty parameter*
entry.description: The FIPS 140-2 Level 1 crypto mode only contains partial support for OAEP. It only supports SHA-1 digest algorithm with an empty parameter string. This RSA OAEP encryption failed because it involved a non-empty parameter string and the DataPower Gateway is in FIPS mode. The Permissive crypto mode does not have these restrictions on its OAEP support.
entry.suggestion: Use zero length OAEP parameters with SHA-1 digest algorithm or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: bad_oaep_digest_enc
entry.text: *RSA OAEP encryption failed due to digest algorithm %s*
entry.description: The FIPS 140-2 Level 1 crypto mode only contains partial support for OAEP. It only supports SHA-1 digest algorithm with an empty parameter string. This RSA OAEP encryption failed because it involved a digest algorithm other than SHA-1 and the DataPower Gateway is in FIPS mode. The Permissive crypto mode does not have these restrictions on its OAEP support.
entry.suggestion: Use zero length OAEP parameters with SHA-1 digest algorithm or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: pkcs7_encrypt_banned_alg
entry.text: PKCS#7 encrypt error: banned encryption algorithm '%s'
entry.description: dp:pkcs7-encrypt() failed due to an argument specifying a banned algorithm. In FIPS mode the DataPower Gateway does not support RC2.
entry.suggestion: Use an encryption algorithm such as AES or 3DES that is allowed in FIPS mode or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: pkcs7_decrypt_banned_alg
entry.text: PKCS#7 decrypt: failed to decrypt for identification credentials '%s' due to banned algorithm
entry.description: A PKCS#7 enveloped-data object passed to dp:pkcs7-decrypt() did not decrypt successfully for one of the recipients due to the presence of a banned algorithm (probably RC2). In FIPS mode the DataPower Gateway does not support RC2.
entry.suggestion: Use an encryption algorithm such as AES or 3DES that is allowed in FIPS mode or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: pkcs7_sign_banned_alg
entry.text: PKCS#7 sign error: banned signing algorithm '%s'
entry.description: dp:pkcs7-sign() failed due to an argument specifying a banned algorithm. In FIPS mode the DataPower Gateway does not support MD5.
entry.suggestion: Use a signing algorithm such as RSA with SHA-256 that is allowed in FIPS mode or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: pkcs7_verify_banned_alg
entry.text: PKCS#7 verify error: signature from '%s' failed verification due to banned algorithm
entry.description: A PKCS#7 signed-data object passed to dp:pkcs7-verify() contained a signature that did not verify successfully due to the presence of a banned algorithm (probably MD5). In FIPS mode the DataPower Gateway does not support MD5.
entry.suggestion: Use a signing algorithm such as RSA with SHA-256 that is allowed in FIPS mode or switch to the Permissive crypto mode.

entry.name: radius_challenge

entry.description: User is not accepted, a challenge response code is issued from RADIUS server.

entry.name: radius_invalid_state
entry.text: Request to RADIUS server for user '%1$s' contains an invalid State, it will be ignored.
entry.description: User is not accepted, a challenge response code is issued from RADIUS server.

entry.name: common_criteria_crypto_card_enabled
entry.text: Common Criteria: The cryptographic card is not disabled.
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway is in Common Criteria mode, but the cryptographic card is enabled. To be Common Criteria compliant, the cryptographic card must be disabled.
entry.suggestion: To disable the cryptographic card, use the crypto-hw-disable command with the all keyword. After you disable the cryptographic card, reload the firmware. If you do not want the DataPower Gateway in Common Criteria mode, reinitialize the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: common_criteria_not_enough_entropy
entry.text: Common Criteria: Entropy is insufficient for pseudo-random number generation.
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway is in Common Criteria mode and has insufficient entropy for its pseudo-random number generator to satisfy Common Criteria mode.
entry.suggestion: Reboot the DataPower Gateway. If the message persists, contact IBM Support.

entry.name: common_criteria_ok
entry.text: Common Criteria: Pseudo-random number generator requisite is satisfied.
entry.description: The DataPower Gateway is in Common Criteria mode, and has sufficient entropy for its pseudo-random number generator.
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: issuerdn_format_deprecated
entry.text: Issuer DN '%s' is specified in non LDAP DN order. This option is deprecated. Certificate lookup will fail when this option is removed.
entry.description: DataPower tries to detect the DN order from the location of the "C" attribute. The option of auto detection is deprecated in 7.0.0. Issuer DN must always be specified in LDAP DN order.
entry.suggestion: Update your request to ensure that the issuer DN is in the LDAP DN order. Otherwise, the certificate lookup will fail when this option is removed in a future release.

entry.name: decrypt_key_short

entry.description: The TLS Forwarder connection is not set up successfully.
entry.suggestion: Check the shown TLS client host, port and the TLS settings of TLS Proxy Profile.

entry.name: SetupBackSSLForwarder

entry.description: The TLS proxy is working as TLS client.
entry.suggestion: This message is for informational purposes.

entry.name: BackSSLFailed

entry.description: The TLS Forwarder connection is not set up successfully.
entry.suggestion: Check the shown TLS server host, port and the TLS settings of TLS Proxy Proxy.

entry.name: SSLForwarderHangup
entry.text: Network error occurred. Hanging Up.
entry.description: The TLS forwarder connection is failed due to a network error.
entry.suggestion: Check the peer status and TLS settings on both ends.

entry.name: insecure_server_rejected
entry.text: TLS handshake stopped due to detection of insecure TLS server
entry.description: The DataPower TLS client detected that the remote TLS server does not support secure renegotiation (RFC 5746). To avoid being subject to a security vulnerability (CVE-2009-3555) the DataPower TLS client aborted the TLS handshake.
entry.suggestion: The only fix for this condition that is not a security risk is to upgrade the TLS stack on the TLS server in question to a software version that supports RFC 5746. If this is not possible, then enable the TLS profile setting that permits connections to insecure TLS servers to allow TLS connections to this server to succeed with unsecured renegotiations.

entry.name: insecure_client_renego_rejected
entry.text: TLS renegotiation stopped due to detection of insecure TLS client
entry.description: The DataPower TLS server detected that the remote TLS client does not support secure renegotiation (RFC 5746). To avoid being subject to a security vulnerability (CVE-2009-3555) the DataPower TLS server stopped the TLS handshake.
entry.suggestion: The only fix for this condition that is not a security risk is to upgrade the TLS stack on the TLS client in question to a software version that supports RFC 5746. If this is not possible, then in the Crypto Profile, TLS server profile, or TLS SNI server profile, enable the TLS option that permits insecure renegotiation to a legacy TLS client to allow unsecured TLS renegotiation with this client to succeed. The Crypto Profile is deprecated.

entry.name: trunc_alert_retry
entry.text: Waiting to finish sending of partially sent TLS closure alert
entry.description: The TLS stack encountered TCP congestion after starting to send out an TLS closure alert (close_notify). It will wait for the congestion to clear in order to send out the rest of the TLS closure alert before the TCP connection is closed.
entry.suggestion: This message is for debug purposes only.

entry.name: trunc_alert_timeout
entry.text: Timed out while waiting to finish sending of partially sent TLS closure alert
entry.description: The TLS stack encountered TCP congestion after starting to send out an TLS closure alert (close_notify). It tried to wait for the congestion to clear in order to send out the rest of the TLS closure alert before closing the TCP connection, but a timeout was reached. The TCP connection was closed without sending the rest of the TLS closure alert.
entry.suggestion: Take steps to improve the TCP connection quality between the DataPower Gateway and this particular TLS peer.

entry.name: connlimit
entry.text: Unable to accept a new client connection due to the connection limit of %u.
entry.description: The TLS Proxy service rejected the client connection. There are too many existing client connections established.
entry.suggestion: Either have the client wait for a connection to become available or increase the connection limit. Before increasing the connection limit, ensure that the server can handle the additional load.

entry.name: noresources
entry.text: Unable to accept a new client connection due to the lack of resources (%d).
entry.description: The TLS Proxy service rejected the client connection. There are not enough system resources available to process a new connection.
entry.suggestion: Wait for resources to become available before attempting to establish new connections.

entry.name: nohost
entry.text: Failed to resolve or connect to hostname '%1$s' (%2$d).
entry.description: The TLS Proxy service rejected the client connection. The service either cannot resolve the hostname for the remote server or cannot establish a connection to the remote server.
entry.suggestion: Verify the hostname of the remote server, availability of ephemeral ports and the availability of the DNS server.

entry.name: nobackconn
entry.text: The server connection is no longer available (%d).
entry.description: The connection from the TLS Proxy service to the server is no longer available. Closing the client connection.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the server is healthy.

entry.name: nofrontconn
entry.text: The client connection is no longer available (%d).
entry.description: The connection from the TLS Proxy service to the client is no longer available. Closing the server connection.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the client is healthy.

entry.name: sslforwardertimeout
entry.text: Reached the transaction timeout value.
entry.description: The timeout value for the transaction was reached. Closing the client and server connections.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the client and the server are not experiencing unexpected load.

entry.name: sslforwarderfronterror
entry.text: Network error (%s) occurred on the client-side interface.
entry.description: The client is unreachable. Due to a network error, lost the connection between the TLS Proxy service and the client.
entry.suggestion: Check the client status and TLS settings on both ends of the connection.

entry.name: sslforwarderbackerror
entry.text: Network error (%s) occurred on server-side interface.
entry.description: The server is unreachable. Due to a network error, lost the connection between the TLS Proxy service and the server.
entry.suggestion: Check the server status and TLS settings on both ends of the connection.

entry.name: sslnewsession
entry.text: TLS handshake initiated to '%1$s:%2$d' with a new TLS session
entry.description: Client-side TLS session caching is enabled, and a TLS handshake was initiated with a new TLS session.

entry.name: sslreusedsession
entry.text: TLS handshake initiated to '%1$s:%2$d' with a cached TLS session (%3$s)
entry.description: Client-side TLS session caching is enabled, and a TLS handshake was initiated with a cached TLS session.

entry.name: gsh_protocol_version_alert
entry.text: Fatal Protocol Version alert received from TLS server instead of ServerHello
entry.description: The TLS server responded to a ClientHello with a fatal Protocol Version alert which terminated the handshake. This alert usually indicates that the protocol version supplied by the client is lower than the minimum version required by the server. It may indicate that a non-compliant TLS server only speaks TLS 1.0 and earlier but reacts incorrectly to ClientHello messages that offer TLS 1.1 or TLS 1.2.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TLS server is configured to support at least one protocol version that is also supported on the TLS client. If the server and client are configured with a common protocol version and this alert still happens (due to a non-compliant server), then either upgrade the server software to fix the non-compliant ClientHello handling or disable support for TLS 1.1 and TLS 1.2 in the Crypto Profile of the DataPower TLS client.

entry.name: gsh_handshake_failure_alert
entry.text: Fatal Handshake Failure alert received from TLS server instead of ServerHello
entry.description: The TLS server responded to a ClientHello with a fatal Handshake Failure alert which terminated the handshake. This alert indicates that the server rejected some unspecified aspect of the ClientHello message. It may indicate that a non-compliant TLS server only speaks TLS 1.0 and earlier but reacts incorrectly to ClientHello messages that offer TLS 1.1 or TLS 1.2.
entry.suggestion: Review the TLS server logs for more specific details. If the server and client are configured with a common protocol version and this alert still happens (due to a non-compliant server), then either upgrade the server software to fix the non-compliant ClientHello handling or disable support for TLS 1.1 and TLS 1.2 in the Crypto Profile or TLS client profile of the DataPower TLS client.

entry.name: gsh_other_fatal_alert
entry.text: Fatal alert %d received from TLS server instead of ServerHello
entry.description: The TLS server responded with the specified fatal alert value which terminated the handshake.
entry.suggestion: Consult Appendix A.3 of RFC 5246 for the meaning of this alert value.

entry.name: gsh_unsupported_protocol
entry.text: Server negotiated an unsupported TLS protocol version
entry.description: The TLS server chose a protocol version that is not supported by the DataPower TLS client configuration.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TLS server is configured to support at least one protocol version that is also supported by the TLS client.

entry.name: gsh_unknown_protocol
entry.text: Server negotiated an unknown protocol version
entry.description: The TLS server chose a protocol version that is not known by the client. This should never happen when connecting to a compliant TLS server (it should not attempt versions higher than what are initially offered by the client).
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the TLS server is actually an TLS server and not a server for some other protocol (like HTTP).

entry.name: sslc_idcred_not_up
entry.text: Identification Credentials '%s' is not yet up
entry.description: Identification credential for the TLS client profile is not up
entry.suggestion: There might be a problem with the selected identification credential. Verify its status.

entry.name: sslc_valcred_not_up
entry.text: Validation Credentials '%s' is not yet up
entry.description: Validation credential for the TLS client profile is not up
entry.suggestion: There might be a problem with the selected validation credential. Verify its status.

entry.name: sslc_invalid_cipher
entry.text: An error occurred when setting TLS client cipher value
entry.description: An error occurred when defining the cipher suite settings on the TLS client profile.
entry.suggestion: Some cipher suites are valid only with certain kinds of key pairs (RSA versus DSA). Ensure that at least one of the configured cipher suites is valid with the key pair in the identification credentials.

entry.name: sslc_invalid_credentials
entry.text: An error occurred when setting TLS client identification credentials
entry.description: An error occurred when setting the private key and corresponding certificate on the TLS client profile.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the key and certificate in the identification credentials use a supported algorithm (RSA, ECDSA, or DSA).

entry.name: ssls_idcred_not_up
entry.text: Identification Credentials '%s' is not yet up
entry.description: Identification credential for the TLS server profile is not up
entry.suggestion: There might be a problem with the selected identification credential. Verify its status.

entry.name: ssls_valcred_not_up
entry.text: Validation Credentials '%s' is not yet up
entry.description: Validation credential for the TLS server profile is not up
entry.suggestion: There might be a problem with the selected validation credential. Verify its status.

entry.name: ssls_invalid_cipher
entry.text: An error occurred when setting TLS server cipher value
entry.description: An error occurred when defining the cipher suite settings on the TLS server profile.
entry.suggestion: Some cipher suites are valid only with certain kinds of key pairs (RSA versus DSA). Ensure that at least one of the configured cipher suites is valid with the key pair in the identification credentials.

entry.name: ssls_invalid_credentials
entry.text: An error occurred when setting TLS server identification credentials
entry.description: An error occurred when setting the private key and corresponding certificate on the TLS server profile.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the key and certificate in the identification credentials use a supported algorithm (RSA, ECDSA, or DSA).

entry.name: ssls_idcred_missing
entry.text: Identification Credentials missing in TLS server profile
entry.description: Identification credentials are required for the given TLS server profile but are missing.
entry.suggestion: Select a valid identification credentials object in this TLS server profile.

entry.name: ssls_valcred_missing
entry.text: Validation Credentials missing in TLS server profile
entry.description: Validation credentials are required for the given TLS server profile but are missing.
entry.suggestion: Select a valid validation credentials object in this TLS server profile.

entry.name: no_cert
entry.text: TLS peer did not send a certificate during the handshake
entry.description: The TLS handshake failed because the peer did not send a certificate
entry.suggestion: If the TLS peer is not supposed to send a certificate during the handshake then reconfigure the TLS configuration so that this is not required.

entry.name: cert_validation_failed
entry.text: TLS handshake certificate validation error with validation credentials %1$s: %2$s
entry.description: The TLS handshake failed because the peer certificate failed certificate validation against the given validation credentials.
entry.suggestion: Adjust the validation credentials object in question if this peer certificate should have passed certificate validation.

entry.name: accept_with_down_profile
entry.text: Incoming TLS handshake failed because TLS server profile was down
entry.description: The TLS server profile that was responsible for an incoming TLS connection was in the down operational state, which caused the handshake to fail.
entry.suggestion: Correct the configuration of the TLS server profile to bring its operational state to up.

entry.name: connect_with_down_profile
entry.text: Outgoing TLS handshake failed because TLS client profile was down
entry.description: The TLS client profile that was responsible for an outgoing TLS connection was in the down operational state, which caused the handshake to fail.
entry.suggestion: Correct the configuration of the TLS client profile to bring its operational state to up.

entry.name: connect_with_bad_sni_hostname
entry.text: Outgoing TLS handshake failed because hostname %s was too long for SNI field
entry.description: The TLS Client Profile in question was attempting to do SNI but the hostname in question was too long.
entry.suggestion: Use a shorter hostname or disable SNI on this TLS client profile.

entry.name: ssls_ssls_not_up
entry.text: TLS server profile '%s' is not yet up
entry.description: The referenced TLS server profile is not up
entry.suggestion: There might be a problem with the selected TLS server profile. Verify its status.

entry.name: sslc_valcred_missing
entry.text: Validation Credentials missing in TLS client profile
entry.description: Validation credentials are required for the given TLS client profile but are missing
entry.suggestion: Select a valid validation credentials object in this TLS client profile.

entry.name: ssls_ssls_missing
entry.text: TLS server profile missing in TLS SNI server profile
entry.description: A non-SNI TLS server profile is required for the given TLS SNI server profile but is missing
entry.suggestion: Select a valid non-SNI TLS server profile in this TLS SNI server profile.

entry.name: ssls_terminate_per_config
entry.text: TLS connection is terminated per TLS Profile, %s.
entry.description: TLS connection is terminated by DataPower per TLS server profile

entry.name: sslsni_missing_snimapping
entry.text: Host Name to TLS Server Profile Mapping is missing in the TLS SNI Server Profile
entry.description: Host Name to TLS Server Profile Mapping is required for the given TLS SNI server profile but is missing
entry.suggestion: Select a valid Host Name to TLS Server Profile Mapping object in this TLS SNI server profile.

entry.name: library_error
entry.text: TLS library error: %s
entry.description: TLS library error

entry.name: ssls_invalid_curve
entry.text: Error setting TLS server elliptic curve value
entry.description: An error occurred while trying to set the elliptic curve settings on the given TLS server profile
entry.suggestion: Some elliptic curves are not allowed in FIPS mode. If the DataPower Gateway runs in FIPS mode, make sure to include only allowed curves.

entry.name: sslc_invalid_curve
entry.text: Error setting TLS client elliptic curve value
entry.description: An error occurred while trying to set the elliptic curve settings on the given TLS client profile
entry.suggestion: Some elliptic curves are not allowed in FIPS mode. If the DataPower Gateway runs in FIPS mode, make sure to include only allowed curves.

entry.name: quiet_shutdown
entry.text: Connection hangup or timeout encountered, TLS closure alert not sent completely.
entry.description: The TLS stack encountered TCP congestion after starting to send out an TLS closure alert (close_notify). Because a hangup or a timeout was encountered, the TCP connection was closed without trying to send the rest of the TLS closure alert.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support if the TLS peer has issues with this feature.

entry.name: error_shutdown_no_sslinfo
entry.text: Shutdown error, no TLS connection info
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while trying to tear down an TLS connection.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: error_shutdown_no_streamctrl
entry.text: Shutdown error, stream has invalid control functions
entry.description: An internal error occurred in the TLS subsystem while trying to tear down an TLS connection.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: custom_sni_hostname
entry.text: User-defined SNI host name %s is being used

entry.name: ssls_unmatched_credentials
entry.text: An error occurred when setting TLS server identification credentials - no matching cipher suite
entry.description: There is no matching cipher suite for the private key and corresponding certificate on the TLS server profile.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that at least one cipher suite algorithm matches the key and certificate in the identification credentials (RSA, ECDSA, or DSA).

entry.name: sslc_unmatched_credentials
entry.text: An error occurred when setting TLS client identification credentials - no matching cipher suite
entry.description: There is no matching cipher suite for the private key and corresponding certificate on the TLS client profile.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that at least one cipher suite algorithm matches the key and certificate in the identification credentials (RSA, ECDSA, or DSA).

entry.name: sslsni_duplicate_snimapping
entry.text: Duplicate host name %1$s exists in the SNI map for TLS host name mapping.
entry.description: This SNI map for TLS host name mapping contains a duplicate host name, which is not allowed. Host names must be unique.
entry.suggestion: Correct the duplicate host name to ensure that it is unique or delete the duplicate host name.

entry.name: handshake_detail
entry.text: %s

entry.name: sslc_cred_validation_unreachable
entry.text: Server certificate validation cannot be performed when host name validation fail on error is enabled.
entry.description: When host name validation and fail on validation are both enabled, any failure in host name comparison will terminate handshake before performing server certificate validation.
entry.suggestion: Disable either host name validation fail on error or server certificate validation property.

entry.name: ssls_invalid_sigalg
entry.text: Error setting signature algorithm for TLS server profile

entry.name: sslc_invalid_sigalg
entry.text: Error setting signature algorithm for TLS server profile

entry.name: no_tls13_ciphers
entry.text: Error setting TLSv1.3 ciphers
entry.description: An error occurred while trying to set ciphers for TLSv1.3.
entry.suggestion: TLSv1.3 defines new ciphers and at least one cipher must be selected for TLSv1.3 to work.

entry.name: tls13_not_supported
entry.text: Error setting TLSv1.3 because of HSM compatibility
entry.description: An error occurred while trying to enable a TLS profile with only TLSv1.3 on this platform. The HSM on 8436-53X appliances does not support TLSv1.3.
entry.suggestion: Edit the TLS profile and select another protocol version or use a key that is not stored on the HSM.

entry.name: tls13_deactivated
entry.text: Disabled TLSv1.3 protocol in the TLS profile configuration because of HSM compatibility
entry.description: An error occurred while trying to enable TLSv1.3 in a TLS profile on this platform. TLSv1.3 is disabled. The HSM on 8436-53X appliances does not support TLSv1.3.
entry.suggestion: When you must use TLSv1.3 on this platform, use a key that is not stored on the HSM.

entry.name: BackSSLFailed
entry.text: Failed to connect to cloud gateway '%1$s' port '%2$d' using TLS profile '%3$s'.
entry.description: The Cloud Connector connection is not set up successfully.
entry.suggestion: Check the shown Cloud Gateway host, port and the TLS client-side settings of the TLS Proxy Proxy.

entry.name: CloseSSLConndebug
entry.text: Starting TLS termination of connection %1$s %2$s
entry.description: The TLS connection shown is being terminated.
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: NoSSLConnection
entry.text: Error accepting TLS connection.
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway request can not be handled because the TLS manager is not ready, TLS connection is being terminated. This is an internal error.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: SetupFrontCloudGateway
entry.text: Establishing TLS connection to Cloud Gateway using TLS profile '%1$s', TLS on front.
entry.description: Accepting the TLS connection, the Cloud Gateway is working as TLS server.
entry.suggestion: This message is for informational purposes.

entry.name: FrontSSLFailed
entry.text: Failed to accept TLS connection using TLS profile '%1$s'.
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway connection is not set up successfully.
entry.suggestion: Check the server-side TLS settings of the named TLS Proxy Proxy.

entry.name: SetupBackCloudGateway
entry.text: Establishing TLS connection to %1$s %2$d. TLS on Back.
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway is working as TLS client.
entry.suggestion: This message is for informational purposes.

entry.name: BackSSLFailed
entry.text: Failed to connect TLS server '%1$s' port '%2$d' using TLS profile '%3$s'.
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway connection is not set up successfully.
entry.suggestion: Check the shown TLS server host, port and the TLS client-side settings of TLS Proxy Proxy.

entry.name: CloudGatewayHangup
entry.text: Network error occurred. Hanging Up.
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway connection is failed due to a network error.
entry.suggestion: Check the peer status and TLS settings on both ends.

entry.name: insecure_server_rejected
entry.text: TLS handshake stopped due to detection of insecure TLS server
entry.description: The DataPower TLS client detected that the remote TLS server does not support secure renegotiation (RFC 5746). To avoid being subject to a security vulnerability (CVE-2009-3555) the DataPower TLS client aborted the TLS handshake.
entry.suggestion: The only fix for this condition that is not a security risk is to upgrade the TLS stack on the TLS server in question to a software version that supports RFC 5746. If this is not possible, then enable the TLS Proxy Profile or TLS client profile setting that permits connections to insecure TLS servers to allow TLS connections to this server to succeed with unsecured renegotiations. The TLS proxy profile is deprecated.

entry.name: insecure_client_renego_rejected
entry.text: TLS renegotiation stopped due to detection of insecure TLS client
entry.description: The DataPower TLS server detected that the remote TLS client does not support secure renegotiation (RFC 5746). To avoid being subject to a security vulnerability (CVE-2009-3555) the DataPower TLS server stopped the TLS handshake.
entry.suggestion: The only fix for this condition that is not a security risk is to upgrade the TLS stack on the TLS client in question to a software version that supports RFC 5746. If this is not possible, then in the Crypto Profile enable the TLS Option that permits insecure renegotiation to a legacy TLS client to allow unsecured TLS renegotiation with this client to succeed.

entry.name: trunc_alert_retry
entry.text: Waiting to finish sending of partially sent TLS closure alert
entry.description: The TLS stack encountered TCP congestion after starting to send out an TLS closure alert (close_notify). It will wait for the congestion to clear in order to send out the rest of the TLS closure alert before the TCP connection is closed.
entry.suggestion: This message is for debug purposes only.

entry.name: trunc_alert_timeout
entry.text: Timed out while waiting to finish sending of partially sent TLS closure alert
entry.description: The TLS stack encountered TCP congestion after starting to send out an TLS closure alert (close_notify). It tried to wait for the congestion to clear in order to send out the rest of the TLS closure alert before closing the TCP connection, but a timeout was reached. The TCP connection was closed without sending the rest of the TLS closure alert.
entry.suggestion: Take steps to improve the TCP connection quality between the DataPower Gateway and this particular TLS peer.

entry.name: connlimit
entry.text: Unable to accept a new client connection due to the connection limit of %u.
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway service rejected the client connection. There are too many existing client connections established.
entry.suggestion: Either have the client wait for a connection to become available or increase the connection limit. Before increasing the connection limit, ensure that the server can handle the additional load.

entry.name: noresources
entry.text: Unable to accept a new client connection due to the lack of resources (%d).
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway service rejected the client connection. There are not enough system resources available to process a new connection.
entry.suggestion: Wait for resources to become available before attempting to establish new connections.

entry.name: nohost
entry.text: Failed to resolve or connect to hostname '%1$s' (%2$d).
entry.description: The Cloud Gateway service rejected the client connection. The service either cannot resolve the hostname for the remote server or cannot establish a connection to the remote server.
entry.suggestion: Verify the hostname of the remote server, availability of ephemeral ports and the availability of the DNS server.

entry.name: nobackconn
entry.text: The server connection is no longer available (%d).
entry.description: The connection from the Cloud Gateway service to the server is no longer available. Closing the client connection.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the server is healthy.

entry.name: nofrontconn
entry.text: The client connection is no longer available (%d).
entry.description: The connection from the Cloud Gateway service to the client is no longer available. Closing the server connection.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the client is healthy.

entry.name: cloudgatewaytimeout
entry.text: Reached the transaction timeout value.
entry.description: The timeout value for the transaction was reached. Closing the client and server connections.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the client and the server are not experiencing unexpected load.

entry.name: cloudgatewayfronterror
entry.text: Network error (%s) occurred on the client-side interface.
entry.description: The client is unreachable. Due to a network error, lost the connection between the Cloud Gateway service and the client.
entry.suggestion: Check the client status and TLS settings on both ends of the connection.

entry.name: cloudgatewaybackerror
entry.text: Network error (%s) occurred on server-side interface.
entry.description: The server is unreachable. Due to a network error, lost the connection between the Cloud Gateway service and the server.
entry.suggestion: Check the server status and TLS settings on both ends of the connection.

entry.name: sslnewsession
entry.text: TLS handshake initiated to '%1$s:%2$d' with a new TLS session
entry.description: Client-side TLS session caching is enabled, and a TLS handshake was initiated with a new TLS session.

entry.name: sslreusedsession
entry.text: TLS handshake initiated to '%1$s:%2$d' with a cached TLS session (%3$s)
entry.description: Client-side TLS session caching is enabled, and a TLS handshake was initiated with a cached TLS session.

entry.text: Fatal alert %d received from TLS server instead of ServerHello
entry.description: The TLS server responded with the specified fatal alert value which terminated the handshake.
entry.suggestion: Consult Appendix A.3 of RFC 5246 for the meaning of this alert value.

entry.name: gsh_unsupported_protocol

entry.description: The TLS server chose a protocol version that is not supported by the DataPower TLS client configuration.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TLS server is configured to support at least one protocol version that is also supported by the TLS client.

entry.name: gsh_unknown_protocol

entry.description: The TLS server chose a protocol version that is not known by the client. This should never happen when connecting to a compliant TLS server (it should not attempt versions higher than what are initially offered by the client).

entry.name: badheaderlength
entry.text: Invalid header length %d
entry.description: Error while receiving header length
entry.suggestion: Ensure cloud-based client connector is set up correctly

entry.name: badheaderdata
entry.text: Invalid header data expected %1$d, received %2$d
entry.description: Error while receiving header data
entry.suggestion: Ensure the cloud-based client connector is set up correctly

entry.name: servicenotfound
entry.text: Service %s not found
entry.description: Service not found
entry.suggestion: Ensure cloud-based client connector is set up correctly

entry.name: cloudsslppnotreverse
entry.text: Cloud-side TLS proxy profile %1$s not Reverse
entry.description: TLS Proxy Profile specified for the cloud-side connection is not defined as Reverse.
entry.suggestion: Choose an TLS Proxy Profile that is defined with Direction Reverse

entry.name: servicesslppnotforward
entry.text: Application-side TLS proxy profile %1$s not Forward
entry.description: TLS Proxy Profile specified for the application-side connection is not defined as Forward.
entry.suggestion: Leave the application-side TLS Proxy Profile blank, or choose one that is defined with direction Forward.

entry.name: apreqdecodefailed
entry.text: %1$s: cannot decode Kerberos AP-REQ message: '%2$.10s'
entry.description: The base-64 encoded Kerberos AP-REQ message could not be base-64 decoded. The encoded AP-REQ may have been corrupted.

entry.name: apreqparsefailed
entry.text: %1$s: cannot parse Kerberos AP-REQ message: '%2$.10s' (error %3$d : %4$s)
entry.description: The Kerberos AP-REQ message could not be parsed. The AP-REQ may have been corrupted.

entry.name: badkeyinfomethod
entry.text: %1$s: unrecognized Kerberos key info method prefix: '%2$s'
entry.description: The Kerberos key info argument did not have a recognized method prefix (currently 'keytabname:' is the only recognized method prefix).

entry.name: badkdcresponse
entry.text: %s: invalid network response from KDC
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC response was either too large or malformed.

entry.name: badprincipalname
entry.text: %1$s: invalid Kerberos principal name: '%2$s'
entry.description: The Kerberos principal name argument could not be parsed.

entry.name: ccachestore
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos credential cache store failed with library error: (%2$d) %3$s
entry.description: A Kerberos credential could not be stored in the credential cache.

entry.name: ctxinit
entry.text: %s: Kerberos context initialization failed
entry.description: A Kerberos context could not be allocated.

entry.name: dnsfailed
entry.text: %1$s: DNS lookup for Kerberos KDC hostname '%2$s' failed
entry.description: The DNS lookup for the Kerberos KDC's host name failed.

entry.name: errcprincipalunknown
entry.text: %1$s: client principal '%2$s' not found in Kerberos KDC database
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC has no knowledge of the client principal.

entry.name: errkeyexpired
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to an expired principal key (or password)
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC responded that the principal's key or password has expired. The key or password must be reset to restore proper operation.
entry.suggestion: Change the password and/or the keytab of the principal in question.

entry.name: errmodified
entry.text: %s: bad (modified) Kerberos AS-REP from KDC
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC responded with an AS-REP message in which one or more fields did not match our AS-REQ (client principal, server principal, nonce, or time fields). The most common reason for this is a case mismatch on the realm name between the KDC and this DataPower Gateway. Try changing the case of the realm name in the Kerberos configuration on this DataPower Gateway for the principals and the KDC.

entry.name: errpreauthrequired
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC '%2$s' required preauthentication that could not be provided
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC required some preauthentication that could not be provided.
entry.suggestion: Double check that your KDC server's realm name matches the KDC configuration object's realm name (as well as the end of any configured Kerberos principal names). This match is case sensitive (and realm names generally involve all upper case characters). A packet capture can confirm whether a realm mismatch is causing this error message (the realm in the Kerberos request will not match the realm in the KDC response in that case). Also, verify that the client principal is correct in your configuration (it should match the credentials in the keytab file which can be seen with the ktutil utility).

entry.name: errsprincipalunknown
entry.text: %1$s: server principal '%2$s' not found in Kerberos KDC database
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC has no knowledge of the server principal.

entry.name: getinitcredstop
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos AS-REQ creation failed (%2$d)
entry.description: A Kerberos AS-REQ message could not be constructed.

entry.name: infoapreqgen
entry.text: %1$s: successfully generated Kerberos AP-REQ: client '%2$s', server '%3$s'
entry.description: This is merely an informational log message about the successful generation of an AP-REQ token.

entry.name: infoapreqparse
entry.text: %1$s: successfully parsed Kerberos AP-REQ: client '%2$s', server '%3$s'
entry.description: This is merely an informational log message about the successful parsing and validation of an AP-REQ token.

entry.name: jitexception
entry.text: %1$s: XSLT compiler failure: %2$s
entry.description: A Kerberos AS-REQ message could not be constructed.

entry.name: kdcnotfound
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC for realm '%2$s' not found
entry.description: A Kerberos KDC object for the specified realm could not be found.
entry.suggestion: Make sure that you have configured a KDC object for any realms for which you have configured Kerberos principals (the realm is the part of the principal after the '@' character). Realm matching is case sensitive (and realms generally consist of all upper case characters).

entry.name: keytabnotfound
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos keytab '%2$s' not found
entry.description: The named Kerberos keytab object could not be found.

entry.name: keytabnotup
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos keytab '%2$s' not up
entry.description: The named Kerberos keytab object is in the operational "down" state.

entry.name: mkreqfailed
entry.text: %s: Kerberos AP-REQ creation failed
entry.description: A Kerberos AP-REQ message could not be constructed.

entry.name: networkreaderror
entry.text: %s: network error receiving reply from Kerberos KDC
entry.description: There was a network error while receiving a reply from the Kerberos KDC.

entry.name: networkwriteerror
entry.text: %s: network error sending request to Kerberos KDC
entry.description: There was a network error while sending a request to the Kerberos KDC.

entry.name: skew
entry.text: %s: Kerberos clock skew was too great while parsing AP-REQ
entry.description: The system clock and the clock on the Kerberos KDC are too far apart. The two clocks must be within five minutes of each other for Kerberos to work properly.
entry.suggestion: Use NTP on both the DataPower Gateway and on the KDC.

entry.name: ticketexpired
entry.text: %s: Kerberos ticket timestamp was expired
entry.description: The timestamp on the Kerberos ticket was invalid (too old).
entry.suggestion: Check the system clock settings and make sure that the time is in sync with the Kerberos KDC.

entry.name: unknownrdreqerror
entry.text: %1$s: Error parsing Kerberos AP-REQ: (%2$d) %3$s
entry.description: The Kerberos AP-REQ message could not be parsed. The AP-REQ may have been corrupted.

entry.name: responsetoobig
entry.text: %s: KDC response was too big to fit into a UDP packet
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC could not fit its response into a UDP packet because the response was too big.
entry.suggestion: Turn on the "Use TCP" toggle for this KDC object.

entry.name: replaydetected
entry.text: %s: Kerberos authenticator replay attack detected
entry.description: The Kerberos token contained an authenticator that has already been seen by this DataPower Gateway. Authenticators may not be reused for security reasons (reuse may indicate a replay attack).
entry.suggestion: Some buggy software (such as Internet Explorer) may resend Kerberos tickets without computing a new authenticator. This is a violation of the Kerberos RFC and ignoring this behavior is a security risk. If you need to interoperate with such software anyway, turn off the "Use Replay Cache" option in the corresponding Kerberos Keytab object.

entry.name: tktnyv
entry.text: %s: Kerberos ticket not yet valid
entry.description: The Kerberos token contained a ticket with a validity period in the future.
entry.suggestion: Check the system clock settings and make sure that the time is in sync with the Kerberos KDC.

entry.name: preauthfailed
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to preauthentication failure
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC rejected the preauthentication in our service ticket request.
entry.suggestion: Check that the client keytab is the right keytab for the client. If the KDC is Microsoft Active Directory, make sure that you are using the latest ktpass utility to extract the client keytab. See MS Knowledge Base Article #919557 regarding buggy versions of ktpass that can cause this error.

entry.name: cacheinsertfailed
entry.text: Failed to set Kerberos KeyIdentifier cache entry
entry.description: A Kerberos KeyIdentifier cache entry could not be set. If the KeyIdentifier is not already present in the cache, further references to this KeyIdentifier will be invalid.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: badkeyid
entry.text: Malformed Kerberos KeyIdentifier
entry.description: The Kerberos KeyIdentifier was either incorrectly base64-encoded, or was an incorrect length.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the KeyIdentifier is correctly formatted

entry.name: nokeyidentry
entry.text: No Kerberos KeyIdentifier found
entry.description: A cached Kerberos AP-REQ message corresponding to the provided KeyIdentifier reference was not found.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the KeyIdentifier reference does not refer to an expired message

entry.name: nokeyidapreq
entry.text: No Kerberos AP-REQ provided for Key Identifier found
entry.description: A Kerberos KeyIdentifier was found not relating to a valid Kerberos AP-REQ message
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the KeyIdentifier message is correctly formatted

entry.name: keyidcollision
entry.text: Kerberos AP-REQ found for incorrect service object
entry.description: A Kerberos KeyIdentifier was used for a service object that did not originally issue the identifier.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: keyid_notincache
entry.text: No cached BinarySecurityToken matches with the Kerberos KeyIdentifier.
entry.description: No Kerberos with the given KeyIdentifier found in the cache.

entry.name: unknown_token
entry.text: Unknown Kerberos token.
entry.description: Unknown Kerberos token found.
entry.suggestion: Ensure the Kerberos token is well-formed.

entry.name: bst_token_reused
entry.text: The Kerberos BinarySecurityToken is reused.
entry.description: The same Kerberos BinarySecurityToken was used before.

entry.name: generic_err_msg
entry.text: %s

entry.name: server_princ_mismatch
entry.text: Configured server principal '%1$s' does not match the ticket server '%2$s'

entry.name: client_princ_mismatch
entry.text: Configured client principal '%1$s' does not match the ticket client '%2$s'

entry.name: ticketextractionfailed
entry.text: %1$s: failed to extract ticket from Kerberos AP-REQ message: '%2$.10s'
entry.description: This failure indicates that the raw ticket cannot be extracted from the AP-REQ during AP-REQ validation. The AP-REQ may have been corrupted.

entry.name: principalcomparisonfailed
entry.text: %1$s: the specified principal '%2$s' does not match the server principal '%3$s' in the ticket
entry.description: When a Service Principal Name (SPN) is configured, the raw ticket is extracted from the AP-REQ and the SPN present in the ticket is compared to the configured SPN. This failure indicates that the configured SPN does not match the SPN in the ticket.
