entry.suggestion: Configure the SPN such that it matches the SPN in the ticket

entry.name: ccache_disabled
entry.text: %1$s: no ticket caching; fetching ticket for client '%2$s' and server '%3$s'
entry.description: Kerberos AP-REQ token generation did not consult a ticket cache.
entry.suggestion: Service ticket caching can be enabled or disabled in the Kerberos Keytab object.

entry.name: ccache_hit
entry.text: %1$s: ticket cache hit for client '%2$s' and server '%3$s'
entry.description: Kerberos AP-REQ token generation found an appropriate cached service ticket and used it rather than contacting the KDC.
entry.suggestion: This message is for informational purposes.

entry.name: ccache_pending
entry.text: %1$s: ticket cache pending for client '%2$s' and server '%3$s'
entry.description: Kerberos AP-REQ token generation waited for a cached service ticket rather than immediately contacting the KDC. Another caller is already in the process of obtaining the ticket.
entry.suggestion: This message is for informational purposes.

entry.name: ccache_poa
entry.text: %1$s: ticket cache miss; fetching ticket for client '%2$s' and server '%3$s'
entry.description: Kerberos AP-REQ token generation contacted the KDC for a service ticket since the ticket cache did not contain any appropriate cached service tickets.
entry.suggestion: This message is for informational purposes.

entry.name: ccache_failure
entry.text: %1$s: ticket cache failure for client '%2$s' and server '%3$s'
entry.description: Kerberos AP-REQ token generation failed while consulting the ticket cache.

entry.name: apreqparsefailed_spnego
entry.text: %1$s: cannot parse SPNEGO header of AP-REQ message: '%2$.10s'
entry.description: The SPNEGO header of the Kerberos AP-REQ message could not be parsed. The SPNEGO token may have been corrupted.

entry.name: apreqparsefailed_gss
entry.text: %1$s: cannot parse GSS header of AP-REQ message: '%2$.10s'
entry.description: The GSS header of the Kerberos AP-REQ message could not be parsed. The GSS token may have been corrupted.

entry.name: rdreq_etype_nosupp
entry.text: %1$s: unsupported ticket encryption type in AP-REQ token (error %2$d: %3$s)
entry.description: The ticket in the AP-REQ token used an encryption type that is not supported by the firmware.
entry.suggestion: Review the configuration of the KDC in question and make sure that it is configured to use encryption algorithms that are also supported by the DataPower firmware (DES, 3DES, RC4, AES).

entry.name: rdreq_tkt_invalid_flag
entry.text: %s: the Invalid flag was set in the AP-REQ token's ticket
entry.description: Kerberos allows the KDC to issue tickets with a flag set called Invalid. These tickets are not directly usable and must be reissued by the KDC at a later time before they can be used. DataPower has no support for handling such tickets in an AP-REQ token and treats the presence of such a ticket as an error.
entry.suggestion: Review the configuration of the KDC in question and make sure that it is configured not to issue Invalid tickets.

entry.name: bad_input_token_method
entry.text: %1$s: unrecognized input token method prefix: '%2$.20s'
entry.description: The Kerberos input token argument did not have a recognized method prefix (currently 'apreq:' is the only recognized prefix).
entry.suggestion: Fix the XSLT that is calling dp:kerberos-get-s4u2proxy so that it passes a valid input token method prefix.

entry.name: ticket_caching_required
entry.text: Ticket caching is required for %1$s but is disabled for realm '%2$s'
entry.description: dp:kerberos-get-s4u2proxy and dp:kerberos-get-s4u2self can only succeed if ticket caching is enabled for the realm in question. This error indicates that the extension function failed because ticket caching is disabled for the realm in question.
entry.suggestion: Reconfigure the KDC config object for this realm so that ticket caching is enabled.

entry.name: three_realm_mismatch
entry.text: %1$s: three principal realms do not match: '%2$.20s', '%3$.20s', '%4$.20s'
entry.description: dp:kerberos-get-s4u2proxy can only succeed if the three principals (client, proxy, and server) are all in the same realm. This error indicates that dp:kerberos-get-s4u2proxy failed because this requirement was not satisfied.
entry.suggestion: dp:kerberos-get-s4u2proxy can only be used within one realm. Use a KDC configuration that follows this convention.

entry.name: kdc_err_none
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC sent KRB_ERROR message with no error in it
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded with a KRB_ERROR message, yet it contained no error.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the KDC logs for more information.

entry.name: kdc_err_cprinc_expired
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected client principal '%2$s' as expired
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the client principal is expired.
entry.suggestion: Adjust the KDC configuration so that the client principal is no longer marked as expired.

entry.name: kdc_err_sprinc_expired
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected server principal '%2$s' as expired
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the server principal is expired.
entry.suggestion: Adjust the KDC configuration so that the server principal is no longer marked as expired.

entry.name: kdc_err_bad_pvno
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected AS-REQ due to bad protocol version
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC rejected the protocol version in the DataPower AS-REQ message.
entry.suggestion: Use a KDC that supports Kerberos version 5.

entry.name: kdc_err_cprinc_old_mast_kvno
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected client '%2$s' secret due to its encryption in an outdated master key
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the client principal's secret was encrypted using an outdated version of the master key (one with a previous key version number).
entry.suggestion: After migrating a KDC to a new master key the administrator may need to regenerate secrets and keytabs for all principals in the realm to avoid this error.

entry.name: kdc_err_sprinc_old_mast_kvno
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected server '%2$s' secret due to its encryption in an outdated master key
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the server principal's secret was encrypted using an outdated version of the master key (one with a previous key version number).
entry.suggestion: After migrating a KDC to a new master key the administrator may need to regenerate secrets and keytabs for all principals in the realm to avoid this error.

entry.name: kdc_err_princ_not_unique
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected request due to a non-unique principal
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that one of the principals was not unique in the KDC database.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that each principal in the KDC database is unique.

entry.name: kdc_err_null_key
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected request due to a null key
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that one of the principals had a null key in the KDC database.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that each principal in the KDC database has a non-null key.

entry.name: kdc_err_cannot_postdate
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected request to postdate a ticket
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC rejected an attempt to postdate a ticket.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that DataPower and the KDC have synchronized clocks.

entry.name: kdc_err_never_valid
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected request for a ticket with zero validity time
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC rejected a request for a ticket with no validity window.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that DataPower and the KDC have synchronized clocks.

entry.name: kdc_err_policy
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to KDC policy
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC rejected the ticket request due to some aspect of KDC policy configuration.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the KDC logs for more information as to why the request was rejected by policy.

entry.name: kdc_err_badoption
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to a bad request option
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC rejected the ticket request due to some request option that it did not like.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the KDC logs for more information as to which request option caused this error.

entry.name: kdc_err_etype_nosupp
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC did not support any of our ticket encryption types
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC could not issue a service ticket using any of our requested encryption types.
entry.suggestion: Adjust the KDC configuration and/or the server keytab so that there is at least one common encryption type shared by DataPower, the KDC, and the server keytab. It is also possible that there are no matching entries for the principal name in the specified keytab file. Make sure you are using the right keytab file that corresponds to the latest secret shared between the principal and the KDC.

entry.name: kdc_err_sumtype_nosupp
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC did not support any of our ticket checksum types
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC could not issue a service ticket using any of our requested checksum types.
entry.suggestion: Adjust the KDC configuration and/or the server keytab so that there is at least one common checksum type shared by DataPower, the KDC, and the server keytab.

entry.name: kdc_err_padatatype_nosupp
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC did not support any of our ticket padata types
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC could not issue a service ticket using any of our requested pre-authentication data (padata) types.
entry.suggestion: Adjust the KDC configuration and/or the server keytab so that there is at least one common pre-authentication data (padata) type shared by DataPower, the KDC, and the server keytab.

entry.name: kdc_err_trtype_nosupp
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC did not support any of our ticket transited types
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC could not issue a service ticket using any of our requested transited types.
entry.suggestion: This should never happen. The DataPower Gateway does not use transited types in ticket requests. Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: kdc_err_client_revoked
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to client '%2$s' having revoked credentials
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the client principal's credentials were revoked.
entry.suggestion: This may be caused by a user account that is disabled, expired, or locked. It may also be caused by trying to use a user account outside of its LoginHours as configured in Active Directory.

entry.name: kdc_err_server_revoked
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to server '%2$s' having revoked credentials
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the server principal's credentials were revoked.
entry.suggestion: This may be caused by a user account that is disabled, expired, or locked. It may also be caused by trying to use a user account outside of its LoginHours as configured in Active Directory.

entry.name: kdc_err_tgt_revoked
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to a revoked TGT
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the ticket-granting ticket (TGT) used in the operation was revoked.
entry.suggestion: Clear the ticket cache so that a new TGT is obtained.

entry.name: kdc_err_client_notyet
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to client principal '%2$s' not being valid yet
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the client principal was not yet valid.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that DataPower and the KDC have synchronized clocks.

entry.name: kdc_err_server_notyet
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to server principal '%2$s' not being valid yet
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the server principal was not yet valid.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that DataPower and the KDC have synchronized clocks.

entry.name: kdc_err_server_nomatch
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to mismatch between ticket and server principal '%2$s'
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the server principal did not match the ticket contained in the ticket request.

entry.name: kdc_err_must_use_user2user
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to server principal '%2$s' only being valid for user2user
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the server principal is only valid for user2user.
entry.suggestion: Use a server principal that is valid in non-user2user scenarios as DataPower does not support user2user.

entry.name: kdc_err_path_not_accepted
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to its transited path
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that the transited path was not accepted.
entry.suggestion: This should never happen. The DataPower Gateway does not generate transited paths in ticket requests. Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: kdc_err_svc_unavailable
entry.text: %s: Kerberos KDC rejected ticket request due to an unavailable service
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed because the KDC responded that a service was unavailable.
entry.suggestion: Consult the KDC logs for more details.

entry.name: kt_resolve_failed
entry.text: %1$s: resolution failed for keytab '%2$s' with error:(%3$d) %4$s
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to a keytab resolution failure. This probably indicates that the DataPower Gateway is out of memory.

entry.name: rdreq_kt_notfound
entry.text: %1$s: no matching entry in keytab '%2$s' during AP-REQ validation (error %3$d : %4$s)
entry.description: The Kerberos AP-REQ validation operation failed due to not being able to find a cryptographic secret in the specified keytab that matched the cryptography that was used in the AP-REQ token. The keytab may be outdated with respect to the user's most recent KDC secret (wrong KVNO) or it may use the wrong type of encryption algorithm.
entry.suggestion: Make sure to use a keytab file that corresponds to the latest secret shared between the principal and the KDC. Make sure to use a keytab file with an encryption algorithm that matches the one that will be used in the KDC tickets issued to the principal.

entry.name: stks_kt_notfound
entry.text: %1$s: no matching entry in keytab '%2$s' while processing KDC response (error %3$d : %4$s)
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to not being able to find a cryptographic secret in the specified keytab that matched the cryptography that was used in the KDC response. The keytab may be outdated with respect to the user's most recent KDC secret (wrong KVNO) or it may use the wrong type of encryption algorithm.
entry.suggestion: Make sure to use a keytab file that corresponds to the latest secret shared between the principal and the KDC. Make sure to use a keytab file with an encryption algorithm that matches the one that will be used in the KDC tickets issued to the principal.

entry.name: rdreq_bad_enctype
entry.text: %s: bad encryption type during AP-REQ validation
entry.description: The Kerberos AP-REQ validation operation failed due to not being able to find a cryptographic secret in the specified keytab that matched the cryptography that was used in the AP-REQ token. The keytab may use the wrong type of encryption algorithm.
entry.suggestion: Make sure to use a keytab file with an encryption algorithm that matches the one that will be used in the KDC tickets issued to the principal.

entry.name: stks_bad_enctype
entry.text: %s: bad encryption type while processing KDC response
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to not being able to find a cryptographic secret in the specified keytab that matched the cryptography that was used in the KDC response. The keytab may use the wrong type of encryption algorithm.
entry.suggestion: Make sure to use a keytab file with an encryption algorithm that matches the one that will be used in the KDC tickets issued to the principal.

entry.name: rdreq_enoent
entry.text: %1$s: keytab '%2$s' file '%3$s' missing during AP-REQ validation
entry.description: The Kerberos AP-REQ validation operation failed due to not being able to open the specified file associated with the specified keytab.
entry.suggestion: Make sure to use a Kerberos Keytab object that points to a file that has not been deleted.

entry.name: stks_enoent
entry.text: %1$s: keytab '%2$s' file missing while processing KDC response
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to not being able to open the file associated with the specified keytab.
entry.suggestion: Make sure to use a Kerberos Keytab object that points to a file that has not been deleted.

entry.name: s4u2proxy_tkt_not_forwardable
entry.text: S4U2Proxy failed due to unforwardable ticket from client '%s'
entry.description: The Kerberos S4U2Proxy operation failed due to the incoming ticket not being marked as Forwardable. This operation cannot work on non-Forwardable tickets.
entry.suggestion: Make the incoming Kerberos client request Forwardable tickets before generating Kerberos tokens if it needs to participate in constrained delegation.

entry.name: s4u2proxy_wrong_client_from_kdc
entry.text: S4U2Proxy failed due to wrong client in KDC response
entry.description: The Kerberos S4U2Proxy operation failed due to the KDC returning a new ticket whose client principal did not match the client principal on the evidence ticket (which violates the S4U2Proxy protocol).
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: s4u2proxy_unknown_error
entry.text: S4U2Proxy failed with library error: (%1$d) %2$s
entry.description: The Kerberos S4U2Proxy operation failed due to an unexpected error.

entry.name: compute_supported_algs
entry.text: %1$s: An unexpected error occurred when reading cryptographic algorithms from keytab '%2$s': (%3$d) %4$s
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to an unexpected error when reading the list of cryptographic algorithms present in the keytab file.

entry.name: rdreq_badintegrity
entry.text: %1$s: integrity check failure on Kerberos AP-REQ message (error %2$d : %3$s)
entry.description: The Kerberos AP-REQ message failed cryptographic integrity checks. The AP-REQ may have been corrupted or the caller may have supplied the wrong password or keytab.

entry.name: stks_badintegrity
entry.text: %1$s: integrity check failure on KDC response (error %2$d : %3$s)
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC response failed cryptographic integrity checks. It may have been corrupted or the caller may have supplied the wrong password or keytab.

entry.name: stks_parsefailed
entry.text: %1$s: cannot parse KDC response (error %2$d : %3$s)
entry.description: The Kerberos KDC response could not be parsed. It may have been corrupted.

entry.name: stks_unknown_error
entry.text: %1$s: An error occurred when fetching from KDC: (%2$d) %3$s
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to an unexpected error when trying to interact with the KDC.

entry.name: disallowed_by_crypto_mode
entry.text: %1$s: Kerberos not supported in current crypto mode
entry.description: The Kerberos operation failed due to the current crypto mode of the DataPower Gateway. The current firmware only runs Kerberos in a crypto mode, such as Permissive mode, that allows the use of MD5. A crypto mode, such as FIPS 140-2 Level 1 mode, that does not allow the use of MD5 will cause all Kerberos operations to fail.
entry.suggestion: Put the DataPower Gateway into a crypto mode that allows the use of MD5.

entry.name: two_realm_mismatch
entry.text: %1$s: The realms of client principal and server principal do not match: '%2$.20s', '%3$.20s'
entry.description: Kerberos functions can succeed only when both the client and the server principals are in the same realm.
entry.suggestion: Kerberos functions can be used only within the same realm. Use a KDC configuration that follows this convention. Note that the realm names are case sensitive.

entry.name: s4u2self_unknown_error
entry.text: S4U2Self failed with library error: (%1$d) %2$s
entry.description: The Kerberos S4U2Self operation failed due to an unexpected error.

entry.name: noversions
entry.text: No LTPA versions configured for authentication
entry.description: When LTPA is chosen as the AAA authentication mechanism, the allowable token versions must be configured. This AAA authentication phase has no LTPA versions chosen.
entry.suggestion: Configure one or more allowable LTPA token versions for AAA authentication

entry.name: badtokentype
entry.text: Unknown LTPA token type: %s

entry.name: noaaapolicy
entry.text: No AAA policy found for LTPA processing
entry.description: The LTPA instance could not find the relevant AAA policy.
entry.suggestion: Reconfigure the AAA policy, or ensure that the current AAA policy is not disabled.

entry.name: notinit
entry.text: LTPA configuration is not initialized
entry.description: When the AAA policy using this LTPA configuration was created, there was an error initializing the LTPA material.
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA parameters are correct, and apply any needed corrections to the relevant AAA policy.

entry.name: nouserid
entry.text: No user identity found to create LTPA token
entry.description: No user identity was passed for LTPA token creation
entry.suggestion: Check that the AAA policy successfully authorized a user identity.

entry.name: multipleuserids
entry.text: More than one user identity found.
entry.description: More than one mapped user identity was passed for LTPA token creation. The first identity will be used.

entry.name: baduserdata
entry.text: Cannot parse LTPA user data
entry.description: WebSphere v1 and v2 LTPA tokens have a user data field that contains name/value attribute pairs regarding the user encoded in the token. This field was malformed in the LTPA token
entry.suggestion: Debug logs should show the output of WebSphere LTPA token decryption. Verify that the user data field is of the appropriate format.

entry.name: couldnotdecrypt
entry.text: LTPA token could not be decrypted: %s
entry.description: The WebSphere LTPA token could not be decrypted
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the cookie header was not corrupted, and that the LTPA key file is the correct key file to decrypt the cookie (the WebSphere instance that generated this cookie is the instance whose exported key files were loaded onto the DataPower Gateway).

entry.name: notbypolicy
entry.text: LTPA token version not allowed by policy
entry.description: The LTPA token was decrypted and decoded, but the version found is not allowed according to this AAA policy's authentication phase configuration.
entry.suggestion: Change the authentication configuration to allow the relevant LTPA token version

entry.name: noparseexpiry
entry.text: Cannot parse expiry %s
entry.suggestion: Verify that the expiry field is a well-formed base 10 value

entry.name: isexpired
entry.text: The LTPA token is expired

entry.name: decryptedv1
entry.text: Decrypted WebSphere v1 LTPA token: %s
entry.description: The WebSphere v1 LTPA token was successfully decrypted

entry.name: decryptedv2
entry.text: Decrypted WebSphere v2 LTPA token: %s
entry.description: The WebSphere v2 LTPA token was successfully decrypted

entry.name: assumedomino
entry.text: Assuming LTPA Domino token

entry.name: infuture
entry.text: Domino LTPA token creation time is in the future
entry.suggestion: Check time skew between Domino server and the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: nov1sig
entry.text: Failed to generate WebSphere v1 LTPA signature
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA key file and key file password are correct

entry.name: v1sig
entry.text: Generated WebSphere v1 LTPA signature

entry.name: nov2sig
entry.text: Failed to generate WebSphere v1 FIPS compliant or WebSphere v2 LTPA signature
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA key file and key file password are correct

entry.name: v2sig
entry.text: Generated WebSphere v1 FIPS compliant or WebSphere v2 LTPA signature

entry.name: badbase64encoded
entry.text: String is not property base64 encoded: %s
entry.description: Material that was expected in base64 format has illegal characters

entry.name: crtok
entry.text: Successfully derived CRT form of RSA private key
entry.description: To speed up RSA private key operations, such as creating signatures, the CRT format of the key is required. This format was correctly derived from the material in the LTPA key file

entry.name: noverify
entry.text: LTPA token signature did not verify
entry.description: LTPA token was decrypted and parsed, but the signature was invalid

entry.name: v1sigdecrypt
entry.text: Cannot decrypt WebSphere v1 LTPA signature
entry.description: Failed to decrypt the WebSphere v1 LTPA signature using the RSA public key
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA key file and key file password are correct.

entry.name: v1padding
entry.text: WebSphere v1 signature padding check failed

entry.name: attrnamevalue
entry.text: LTPA attribute name/value: %1$s/%2$s
entry.description: WebSphere LTPA v1 and v2 tokens can have user-related attribute name/value pairs encoded in the cookie; this is a pair to be added to the cookie being generated.

entry.name: attrnoname
entry.text: Cannot find the name of an LTPA user attribute
entry.description: WebSphere LTPA v1 and v2 tokens can have user-related attribute name/value pairs encoded in the cookie; however, the attribute name was not resolved, and will not be encoded in the token.
entry.suggestion: Check that the AAA LTPA user attributes are correctly configured

entry.name: attrnovalue
entry.text: Cannot find the value of LTPA user attribute %s
entry.description: WebSphere LTPA v1 and v2 tokens can have user-related attribute name/value pairs encoded in the cookie; however, the value relating to the current attribute name could not be resolved, and will not be encoded in the token.
entry.suggestion: Check that the AAA LTPA user attributes are correctly configured

entry.name: attrnamevalue2
entry.text: LTPA attribute name/value decoded from token: %1$s/%2$s
entry.description: WebSphere LTPA v1 and v2 tokens can have user-related attribute name/value pairs encoded in the cookie; this is a pair extracted from the authentication token

entry.name: badrealm
entry.text: LTPA realm from token %1$s does not match configured realm %2$s
entry.description: The realm from the LTPA token does not match the realm from the LTPA key file
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the configured LTPA key file is correct

entry.name: badcustomattr
entry.text: LTPA custom attribute %zd is malformed
entry.description: When generating LTPA tokens, custom name/attribute value pairs can be added to the token. However, the attribute name or value is either missing or malformed, and can't be added to the token.
entry.suggestion: Check that the user attribute name and value pairs are correctly configured, and that any XPath user attribute types have valid XPath expressions

entry.name: dominotooshort
entry.text: Domino token too short: %zu characters
entry.description: Domino tokens have a minimum length, which this token falls short of

entry.name: baddominoheader
entry.text: Domino token header is corrupt
entry.description: Domino tokens have a defined set of header bytes, which was not found

entry.name: badwebsphereuser
entry.text: Unexpected WebSphere user identity attribute format
entry.description: The WebSphere LTPA attribute indicating the user should be prepended with "user:", but that string was not found

entry.name: couldnotinit
entry.text: Cannot initialize LTPA instance
entry.description: The LTPA instance could not be initialized. Attempts to validate or create LTPA tokens will fail.
entry.suggestion: Check the previous log entries to see the exact error causing initialization to fail, and correct the configuration data as needed.

entry.name: couldnotdecryptv1key
entry.text: Cannot decrypt the WebSphere LTPA v1 symmetric key
entry.description: The LTPA key file password is used to derive a key to decrypt certain entries in LTPA key files, including the symmetric key used to encrypt and decrypt LTPA v1 tokens. This configuration entry could not be decrypted by the password-derived decryption key.
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA key file and key file password parameters are correct.

entry.name: assumedominofile
entry.text: Assuming Domino LTPA configuration file
entry.description: Unlike WebSphere LTPA configuration files, Domino configuration files are unstructured and contain only the encoded Domino secret. If an LTPA instance is configured to accept or create Domino tokens, and the file appears unstructured, it is assumed to be the file containing the Domino secret.

entry.name: dominolookslikewebsphere
entry.text: Domino configuration file appears to be a WebSphere file
entry.description: LTPA Domino is the configured token type, but the configuration file is for WebSphere LTPA.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the LTPA key file and supported token type parameters are not mismatched

entry.name: malformedconfigline
entry.text: Malformed LTPA configuration line found
entry.description: The LTPA configuration line was not a comment, but did not contain a "=" character
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA key file has not been corrupted

entry.name: unknownconfig
entry.text: Unknown configuration file entry: %s
entry.description: The configuration parameter found is not known to be a valid WebSphere LTPA configuration parameter; it will be ignored.

entry.name: noltpaconfig
entry.text: Runtime LTPA configuration not found for AAA policy %s
entry.description: No LTPA configuration for the indicated AAA policy was found
entry.suggestion: Check that LTPA is chosen for the authenticate and/or post processing AAA phases.

entry.name: filenotopened
entry.text: Cannot open LTPA configuration file %s
entry.description: The indicated LTPA configuration file could not be opened
entry.suggestion: Verify that the file exists and can be opened

entry.name: filenotparsed
entry.text: Failed to parse LTPA configuration file %s
entry.description: The indicated LTPA configuration file could not be parsed
entry.suggestion: Verify that the file conforms to the LTPA configuration file format

entry.name: filepasswordreqd
entry.text: No password configured for WebSphere LTPA key file
entry.description: WebSphere LTPA configuration files contain some entries which are encrypted; the decryption key is calculated from the key file password. No key file password was configured.
entry.suggestion: Configure the correct LTPA key file password

entry.name: ltpav2sigok
entry.text: WebSphere LTPA v1 FIPS compliant or WebSphere LTPA v2 signature verified

entry.name: websphereparseerror
entry.text: Malformed WebSphere LTPA token

entry.name: notoken
entry.text: No LTPA token found
entry.description: The validate LTPA extension function did not receive an LTPA token
entry.suggestion: Check that the output of the AAA extract identity step contains the LTPA token to verify.

entry.name: notvalid
entry.text: LTPA token was not validated
entry.description: The validate LTPA extension function was not able to validate the LTPA token
entry.suggestion: Check the logs for previous LTPA-related errors to determine the root cause of failure

entry.name: nodecryptkey
entry.text: LTPA file decryption key unavailable
entry.description: To decrypt certain entries in WebSphere LTPA key files, a key file password is required, from which a decryption key is generated. This decryption key is not present.
entry.suggestion: Check that the key file configuration parameter is set

entry.name: unknownversion
entry.text: Unknown LTPA token version
entry.description: The LTPA token version configured is not recognized
entry.suggestion: Check that the LTPA token version(s) configured in the authenticate and/or post processing AAA phases conform to the supported versions

entry.name: dominotimeformat
entry.text: Failed to decode Domino time string
entry.description: The Domino LTPA token contained a malformed time string

entry.name: decrypteddebug
entry.text: Successfully decrypted LTPA token: %s
entry.description: LTPATokenDecryption was successful

entry.name: tamendpointerror
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client error detected; will attempt restart
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint encountered a connectivity error
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the IBM Security Access Manager authorization server and user directory are reachable

entry.name: noclientrestart
entry.text: Cannot restart IBM Security Access Manager client
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client could not restart due to an internal error
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the IBM Security Access Manager configuration information and files are valid and accurate

entry.name: restartedclient
entry.text: Restarted IBM Security Access Manager client (%d)
entry.description: After encountering an error, the IBM Security Access Manager client was able to restart

entry.name: noauthreq
entry.text: Did not find IBM Security Access Manager authentication request
entry.description: The authentication request was not returned by the IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint
entry.suggestion: Check the IBM Security Access Manager client log for more information

entry.name: clientsentshutdown
entry.text: Received IBM Security Access Manager client shutdown notice
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint sent notice that it received a shutdown event

entry.name: clientlogmsg
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager authorization client log message: %s
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager' authorization client sent the indicated log message

entry.name: clientreadagain
entry.text: Continuing to read IBM Security Access Manager client response message
entry.description: Continuing to read the IBM Security Access Manager client respones message

entry.name: clientbadpipe
entry.text: Failed to establish IBM Security Access Manager client communication channel
entry.description: Internal error while creating IBM Security Access Manager client communication channel
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: stoperr
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client may not have shut down gracefully
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client may not have shutdown gracefully in response to a shutdown request
entry.suggestion: Check the IBM Security Access Manager client log for more information

entry.name: nolicense
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager is not licensed for this system
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager firmware license was not found on this system; cannot configure IBM Security Access Manager functionality
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: nofirmware
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager is licensed for this system, but IBM Security Access Manager firmware not found
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager is licensed for this system, but the IBM Security Access Manager firmware is not installed
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: filescreate
entry.text: Signaling IBM Security Access Manager client file creation
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is configured to generate the IBM Security Access Manager client files on the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: replicainternalerr
entry.text: Internal error while adding IBM Security Access Manager authorization replica
entry.description: An internal error was encountered during the configuration of IBM Security Access Manager authorization replicas.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: noclientfile
entry.text: No IBM Security Access Manager client configuration file specified
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is configured to use preexisting client files, but no client configuration file was found. The IBM Security Access Manager object will not be initialized.
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager client configuration file

entry.name: nosslfile
entry.text: No IBM Security Access Manager TLS key database file specified
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is configured to use preexisting client files, but no TLS key database file was found. The IBM Security Access Manager object will not be initialized.
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager TLS key database file

entry.name: nosslstashfile
entry.text: No IBM Security Access Manager TLS key stash file specified
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object was configured to use preexisting client files, but no TLS key stash file was found. The IBM Security Access Manager object will not be initialized.
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager TLS key stash file

entry.name: badsslstashfile
entry.text: An invalid IBM Security Access Manager TLS key stash file was configured
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object ws configured to use preexisting client files, but the configured TLS key stash file is invalid. Make sure that the specified file exists, and is in the indicated directory.
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager TLS key stash file

entry.name: badclientfile
entry.text: An invalid IBM Security Access Manager client configuration file was configured
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object was configured to use preexisting client files, but the configured IBM Security Access Manager client file is invalid and can't be found
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager client configuration file, and make sure it exists in the indicated directory.

entry.name: taminternalfileerr
entry.text: Internal file error - IBM Security Access Manager client will not be initialized
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: tamrewriteexisting
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager config: forcing [%1$s] stanza parameter %2$s to %3$s
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is setting the indicated stanza parameter to the indicated value

entry.name: tamremoveexistingstanza
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager config: removing [%1$s] stanza, %2$s not supported
entry.description: Not all IBM Security Access Manager client file stanzas are required or supported. Removing the indicated stanza.

entry.name: tamremoveexisting
entry.text: IBM Security Manager config: removing [%1$s] stanza entry %2$s: not supported
entry.description: Not all IBM Security Manager client file stanza entries are required or supported. Removing the indicated parameter from the indicated stanza

entry.name: configfilereaderr
entry.text: Failed to open configuration file
entry.description: Cannot open the IBM Security Access Manager client configuration file for reading. IBM Security Access Manager object is not enabled.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the indicated client configuration file exists and is a valid file

entry.name: tamaddtimeout
entry.text: Adding default %1$s search timeout of %2$d seconds
entry.description: The indicated timeout setting was not configured in the IBM Security Access Manager client configuration file; adding the default timeout value indicated
entry.suggestion: The indicated default timeout can be overridden by specifying a value for the indicated parameter greater than or equal to the default

entry.name: tamoverridetimeout
entry.text: Overriding %1$s search timeout of %2$d seconds to %3$d seconds
entry.description: The indicated timeout setting was configured to an inappropriate setting; adding the default timeout value indicated

entry.name: tamenabled
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client successfully enabled (%d)
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager client configuration successfully completed

entry.name: tamfilenotcreated
entry.text: Failed to create IBM Security Access Manager %s configuration file
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager on-DataPower Gateway file configuration failed. IBM Security Access Manager client will not be enabled
entry.suggestion: Check that the entered configuration parameters are valid, and check for any related log messages. If problems persist contact IBM Support

entry.name: tamfilecreated
entry.text: Created IBM Security Access Manager %s configuration file
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager on-DataPower Gateway file configuration succeeded

entry.name: tamgetcacert
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager server CA certificate was successfully retrieved as part of client configuration
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager CA certificate is required for on-DataPower Gateway client file configuration

entry.name: configfilelinkerr
entry.text: Error processing configuration file
entry.description: Error during the processing of the IBM Security Access Manager configuration file.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: sentshutdownok
entry.text: Successfully sent the shutdown message to the IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint
entry.description: When the IBM Security Access Manager object is created or has its configuration updated, the client endpoint must be shutdown and restarted for changes to take effect. The shutdown message was successfully sent.

entry.name: sentshutdownerr
entry.text: Error while sending the shutdown message to the IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint
entry.description: When the IBM Security Access Manager object is created or has its configuration updated, the client endpoint must be shutdown and restarted for changes to take effect. An error occurred while sending the shutdown message.
entry.suggestion: Check for any related log messages.

entry.name: tamdisabledok
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint successfully disabled
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint successfully transitioned to the "disabled" admin state

entry.name: websealdynurlerr
entry.text: Cannot open WebSEAL DynURL file %s
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object was configured to use a WebSEAL DynURL file, but the file could not be opened
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the indicated file is uploaded to the DataPower Gateway, and is valid

entry.name: createfilestart
entry.text: Starting IBM Security Access Manager file creation process
entry.description: Starting to create the required IBM Security Access Manager client configuration files

entry.name: tamgetcacerterr
entry.text: Getting IBM Security Access Manager CA cert failed: %s
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager CA certificate is required for on-DataPower Gateway client file configuration
entry.suggestion: Check that the IBM Security Access Manager client host, port, administrative username, and administrative password are correct

entry.name: tamgenhostconfig
entry.text: Generating IBM Security Access Manager host config succeeded

entry.name: tamgenclientconfigerr
entry.text: Generating IBM Security Access Manager client config failed: %s

entry.name: tamaddreplicaerr
entry.text: Adding IBM Security Access Manager replica failed: %s
entry.description: The indicated IBM Security Access Manager authorization server replica could not be configured for the client endpoint.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the authorization replica host and port are correct, and the authorization replica weight is a value between 1 and 10

entry.name: invalidresponse
entry.text: Error while reading the IBM Security Access Manager authorization attributes
entry.description: Error while reading the IBM Security Access Manager authorization attributes

entry.name: fullattrread
entry.text: Read all returned authorization attribute data
entry.description: See message.

entry.name: attrreadcont
entry.text: Incomplete read of authorization attribute data
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager endpoint has sent back a partial result of the authorization attribute data. Continuing to wait for the entire result.

entry.name: internalconfigerr
entry.text: Internal error; cannot create IBM Security Access Manager configuration files
entry.description: Internal error while creating IBM Security Access Manager configuration files. The files cannot be created, and the IBM Security Access Manager object will be disabled
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: errorparse
entry.text: Cannot parse IBM Security Access Manager authorization attributes: %s
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager endpoint returned an XML representation of the authorization attributes that could not be parsed

entry.name: beginldapgen
entry.text: Starting LDAP registry file creation
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is creating the LDAP registry file on the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: keyfileerr
entry.text: Error reading key files
entry.description: There was an error while processing the configured IBM Security Access Manager key database and stash files. The IBM Security Access Manager object is down.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the configured IBM Security Access Manager key database and stash files exist and are valid.

entry.name: endldapgen
entry.text: Created LDAP registry file
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object has successfully created the LDAP registry file on the DataPower Gateway

entry.name: clientincomplete
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client configuration is incomplete
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is missing required configuration parameters. The client configuration file will not be generated.
entry.suggestion: Check that the client parameters such as application name, administrator, host, port, and password are entered and correct

entry.name: noreplicas
entry.text: No authorization replicas configured
entry.description: No authorization replicas are configured for the IBM Security Access Manager object. The configuration file must contain at least one replica, either added manually or by configuring replicas for the object. If there are no replicas configured for the object but the client configuration file contains at least one valid replica entry, this warning can be ignored.
entry.suggestion: Ensure at least one replica is present in the client configuration file

entry.name: createdreplicas
entry.text: %1$d authorization replica%2$s configured
entry.description: The indicated number of authorization replicas have been configured for the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: clientconfigerr
entry.text: Internal error while processing configuration file
entry.description: An internal error occurred during the processing of the IBM Security Access Manager configuration file.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: commitstart
entry.text: The IBM Security Access Manager object is configured; attempting to start client authorization endpoint
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object was created, along with any necessary configuration files. Attempting to start the client authorization endpoint by initializing its connection with the authorization server.

entry.name: commitstartfail
entry.text: The client authorization endpoint failed initialization after object configuration
entry.description: Although the IBM Security Access Manager object was created and configured, initialization with the authorization server failed.
entry.suggestion: Check the IBM Security Access Manager authorization server logs, and the IBM Security Access Manager object configuration settings for their accuracy.

entry.name: createdclientfile
entry.text: Successfully generated IBM Security Access Manager client runtime configuration file

entry.name: addedreplica
entry.text: Successfully added replica to IBM Security Access Manager configuration - host name '%1$s', port %2$d, weight %3$d

entry.name: failwritetoclient
entry.text: Error sending message to IBM Security Access Manager client; transaction will fail.
entry.description: A runtime error occurred while sending an access control request message to the IBM Security Access Manager client
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: haveobfuscatedfile
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager obfuscation file is present
entry.description: The ps-user-pwd entry in the [aznapi-configuration] stanza was required in IBM Security Access Manager version 4, but subsequent versions allow an obfuscation file to be used, to prevent storing the cleartext password in the configuration file. If the installed firmware uses an IBM Security Access Manager client version later than v4.1, an obfuscation file will be used when the configuration files are generated on the box.

entry.name: unknownversion
entry.text: Unable to determine IBM Security Access Manager client version
entry.description: Unable to determine the IBM Security Access Manager client version.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the IBM Security Access Manager firmware installed successfully

entry.name: allfilesok
entry.text: All IBM Security Access Manager client files have been generated
entry.description: All required IBM Security Access Manager client files to configure an IBM Security Access Manager object have been created and written to the indicated directories.

entry.name: allfilesnotok
entry.text: Failed to generate IBM Security Access Manager client files
entry.description: An error occurred while creating the files necessary for the IBM Security Access Manager runtime environment.
entry.suggestion: Check that all configuration parameters are correct

entry.name: tamgenhostconfigerr
entry.text: Generating host config failed: %s

entry.name: tambadparams
entry.text: Bad params found; IBM Security Access Manager files will not be created
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager file creation parameters were either inappropriate or missing

entry.name: removefileok
entry.text: Removing temporary file %s
entry.description: After either a successful or unsuccessful attempt to create the IBM Security Access Manager client configuration and key files, some temporary files used by the configuration utilities are no longer needed.

entry.name: removefileerr
entry.text: Failed to remove temporary file: %s
entry.description: While configuring an IBM Security Access Manager object, some temporary files are created. An error occurred during configuration object, and the indicated temporary file could not be deleted.

entry.name: nomemory
entry.text: *Not enough memory for allocating space*

entry.name: notfiminfo
entry.text: *Cannot locate TFIM information*

entry.name: keytmpremove
entry.text: Failed to remove temporary key %s file
entry.description: Failed to remove temporary copy of an IBM Security Access Manager TLS key file. This was a preliminary copy; the final file version was placed in the correct directory.

entry.name: replicaerr
entry.text: Error adding authorization replica
entry.description: Error adding indicated failover authorization server replica. The IBM Security Access Manager client endpoint will not be enabled.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the authorization server replica information is correctly entered.

entry.name: invalidreplica
entry.text: Invalid replica IP or host name
entry.description: A replica with an invalid IP address or host name was configured for the IBM Security Access Manager object. The object will be created but the replica will not be added to the running configuration
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the authorization server replica configuration is correctly entered.

entry.name: nosslldapkeyfile
entry.text: No IBM Security Access Manager TLS LDAP key database file specified
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object was configured to use LDAP over TLS, but no TLS LDAP key database file was found. The IBM Security Access Manager object will not be initialized.
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager TLS LDAP key database file, or disable LDAP TLS.

entry.name: badsslldapkeyfile
entry.text: An invalid IBM Security Access Manager TLS LDAP key database file was configured
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is configured to use LDAP over TLS, but the configured TLS LDAP key database file is invalid.
entry.suggestion: Specify a valid IBM Security Access Manager TLS LDAP key database file; if one is specified make sure that it exists, and has a valid directory prefix. Or, disable LDAP TLS.

entry.name: nosslldapkeyfilepassword
entry.text: No IBM Security Access Manager TLS LDAP key file password specified
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is configured to use LDAP over TLS, but not TLS LDAP key database file password was found. The IBM Security Access Manager object will not be initialized.
entry.suggestion: Specify the IBM Security Access Manager TLS LDAP key database file password, or disable LDAP TLS.

entry.name: failedcopytotemp
entry.text: Failed to copy newly-created key files to temporary:
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager file creation process was configured to copy the key files to the temporary: directory, but this copy operation failed. The key files remain in the cert: directory
entry.suggestion: Ensure that adequate file space is available.

entry.name: copiedtotemp
entry.text: Copied newly-created key files to temporary:
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager file creation process was configured to copy the key files to the temporary: directory. The copy operation succeeded

entry.name: infipsmode
entry.text: Operating in FIPS mode
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager is configured to operate in FIPS mode for TLS network communication.

entry.name: nosystemnameconfigured
entry.text: No system name configured
entry.description: New IBM Security Access Manager policy objects are supposed to be created with the local DataPower Gateway id name. If no system name is configured the new object will use the policy server host name instead. Multiple devices attempting to create objects with the same application id could cause conflicts.
entry.suggestion: Configure the System Identifier value in the System Settings menu

entry.name: tamclifailopenhostnamedb
entry.text: Host name database cannot be opened
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client updates the '/etc/hosts' file by adding the System Identifier as an alias for localhost. That file could not be open for writing or it may not be present at all.
entry.suggestion: Add the alias and 'localhost' host names as static hosts in the Configure DNS Settings menu.

entry.name: tamclifailsettingalias
entry.text: The alias host name could not be set
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client updates the '/etc/hosts' file by adding the System Identifier as an alternate for localhost. The alias string could not be appended to the loopback address just entered in the '/etc/hosts' file.
entry.suggestion: Add the alias and 'localhost' host names as static loopback hosts in the Configure DNS Settings menu.

entry.name: tamclifailsettinghostname
entry.text: Failed to add a 'localhost' entry to the host name database
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client updates the '/etc/hosts' file by adding a 'localhost' loopback entry into the '/etc/hosts' file. This update failed.
entry.suggestion: Add the alias and 'localhost' host names as static hosts in the Configure DNS Settings menu.

entry.name: tamclihostnameerror
entry.text: Cannot set the hostname with the system identifier for the DataPower Gateway.
entry.description: The value for the system identifier in system settings cannot be used in the configuration as the hostname. The system identifier might not be configured, might be a name that is longer than 64 characters, or might be '(none)' or '(unknown)'.
entry.suggestion: Check the value of the system identifier property in the System Settings mode. If the value is invalid, change the value.

entry.name: tamthreadstarted
entry.text: Starting IBM Security Access Manager client
entry.description: The thread which spawns the process that executes the IBM Security Access Manager client for a corresponding ISAM object has started.

entry.name: tfimendpointdisabled
entry.text: TFIM endpoint successfully disabled.
entry.description: The administrative state property of the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint object is set to disabled.
entry.suggestion: As the object is disabled it will not be restarted with current properties.

entry.name: tfimnomemservername
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM server name.
entry.description: The value of the mServerURL property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingservername
entry.text: Missing TFIM Server Name.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mServerURL property.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TFIM Server Name was supplied, then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemport
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM port.
entry.description: The value of the mServerPort property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingport
entry.text: Missing TFIM Port.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mServerPort property.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TFIM Port was supplied then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemissuer
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying the TFIM Issuer field.
entry.description: The value of the mIssuer property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimnomemappliestoaddress
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM AppliesTo Address field.
entry.description: The value of the mAppliesToAddress property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingappliestoaddress
entry.text: Missing TFIM Server AppliesTo Address field.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mAppliesToAddress property.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TFIM AppliesTo Address was supplied then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemcompatmode
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM Compatible Mode field.
entry.description: The value of the mCompatibleMode property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingcompatmode
entry.text: Missing TFIM compatible mode.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mCompatibleMode property.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TFIM Compatible Mode was supplied then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemreqtokenformat
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying Request Token Format.
entry.description: The value of the mReqToken6_Format property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingtokenformat
entry.text: Missing TFIM Request Token Format.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mReqToken6_Format property.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TFIM Request Token Format was supplied then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnofilestore
entry.text: Problem getting FileStore.
entry.description: The domain filestore which holds the custom filesheet is not available.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimcannotconvabsloc
entry.text: Problem converting relative custom style sheet location to absolute location on the DataPower Gateway.
entry.description: The domain relative URL could not be converted to an absolute filepath.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the Customer Request URL is valid for the domain then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemcustrequrl
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying Customer Request URL.
entry.description: The value of the Custom Request URL property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingcustrequrl
entry.text: Error accessing Custom Request URL.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mReqCustomURL property.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the TFIM Custom Request URL was supplied then try the 'Apply' operation again. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemporttype
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM PortType field.
entry.description: The value of the mPortType property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimnomemoperation
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM Operation field.
entry.description: The value of the mOperation property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: certrefreshstart
entry.text: Starting ISAM certificate refresh thread.
entry.description: Refresh the password on the IBM Security Access Manager client keystore in case it has expired then obtain a new signer certificate from the ISAM server.

entry.name: tamobjectfound
entry.text: The ISAM configuration object '%s' was found.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object contains the name of the configuration file needed by the server commands for the refresh operation.

entry.name: tamobjectnotfound
entry.text: The ISAM configuration object '%s' was not found.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object contains the name of the configuration file needed by the server commands for the refresh operation.
entry.suggestion: Check the spelling of the provided object name and try again.

entry.name: certrefresh
entry.text: Signalling IBM Security Access Manager certificate refreshing.
entry.description: The certificate refresh activity is starting.

entry.name: invalidrefreshauth
entry.text: An IBM Security Access Manager administrator identifier and administrator password are both required.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client needs to authenticate itself with the ISAM server for the certificate refresh to take place. The certificate is then supplied by the server to the client running on the DataPower Gateway.
entry.suggestion: Check that both the administrator identifier and the administrator password are not empty.

entry.name: tamchgpwd
entry.text: The client keystore password is successfully changed.
entry.description: It is possible that the keystore password has expired in which case the certificate it contains cannot be changed. The password is always changed first to allow for this case.

entry.name: tamchgpwderr
entry.text: The client keystore password could not be changed because of '%s'.
entry.description: If the password cannot be changed then the keystore is likely to be inaccessible. The certificate refresh will not be attempted.
entry.suggestion: The IBM Security Access Manager configuration should be regenerated or new keystore files should be imported into the DataPower Gateway. The existing keystore should be deleted or renamed.

entry.name: tamchgcert
entry.text: The IBM Security Access Manager certificate is successfully refreshed.
entry.description: To refresh the certificate the IBM Security Access Manager server copies its public certificate to the DataPower Gateway into the client's domain.

entry.name: tamchgcerterr
entry.text: The IBM Security Access Manager certificate was not successfully refreshed because of '%s'
entry.description: To refresh the certificate the IBM Security Access Manager server copies its public certificate to the DataPower Gateway into the client's domain. This copy has failed.
entry.suggestion: Check that the IBM Security Access Manager server is running and is accessible from the DataPower Gateway. Try the certificate refresh operation again.

entry.name: certsrefreshed
entry.text: The certificate refresh operation was completed successfully.

entry.name: certsnotrefreshed
entry.text: The certificate refresh operation was not completed successfully.
entry.description: The operations to refresh the keystore failed.
entry.suggestion: Attempt to regenerate the IBM Security Access Manager configuration.

entry.name: tamobjectdisabled
entry.text: The ISAM object '%1$s' in domain '%2$s' was disabled.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client process for this object is terminated prior to a certificate refresh. This is to prevent possible corruption to the keystore.

entry.name: tamobjectenabled
entry.text: The ISAM object '%1$s' in domain '%2$s' was enabled.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client process was restarted and all dependent objects are re-enabled.

entry.name: disablefailedrestarting
entry.text: Cannot enable or disable ISAM object due to restart in progress
entry.description: There is currently another thread restarting the IBM Security Access Manager object. The management request to disable and/or enable the ISAM object cannot be completed.

entry.name: tamrestartinprogress
entry.text: Cannot restart ISAM object due to restart in progress
entry.description: There is currently another thread restarting the IBM Security Access Manager object. The current request to restart the ISAM object cannot be completed.

entry.name: tamstartingclient
entry.text: Attempting to restart the ISAM object
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client is being started or restarted due to a configuration change request by the admin.

entry.name: tamrestartwaitingforclient
entry.text: Waiting for new ISAM client to complete startup: %d seconds elapsed
entry.description: A request to start a new IBM Security Access Manager client has started. Waiting for that process to complete

entry.name: couldnotmakeclientconnection
entry.text: Cannot make internal connection to ISAM client
entry.description: Cannot make internal connection to IBM Security Access Manager client

entry.name: clientconnectionunusable
entry.text: Cannot send request to client due to unusable internal connection
entry.description: Cannot send request to client due to unusable internal connection

entry.name: responseconnectiongone
entry.text: Response connection from ISAM client no longer exists
entry.description: Response connection from IBM Security Access Manager client no longer exists

entry.name: responseconnectionunusable
entry.text: Response connection from ISAM client unusable
entry.description: Response connection from BM Security Access Manager client unusable

entry.name: attemptstopprocess
entry.text: Attempting to shutdown ISAM client
entry.description: Attempting to shutdown IBM Security Access Manager client

entry.name: processalreadystopped
entry.text: ISAM client already shutdown
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager client already shutdown

entry.name: shutdownfailed
entry.text: ISAM client shutdown failed (%d)
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager client shutdown failed

entry.name: shutdownsucceeded
entry.text: ISAM client shutdown succeeded (%d)
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager client shutdown succeeded

entry.name: errorstartingprocess
entry.text: ISAM client could not be started (%1$d:%2$s)
entry.description: IBM Security Access Manager client could not be started

entry.name: tamrestartingclient
entry.text: Attempting to restart the ISAM object due to a failure
entry.description: An IBM Security Access Manager request has encountered an unexpected error. Attemping to restart the IBM Security Access Manager client

entry.name: tamexecutingfail
entry.text: Error executing ISAM object (%1$d:%2$s)
entry.description: An attempt to spawn the IBM Security Access Manager process returned an error.

entry.name: sockstream
entry.text: ISAM socket stream - stream access error.
entry.description: Cannot open a read/write buffer of the required size for the stream or could not associate the socket with the stream.

entry.name: tamsockerror
entry.text: ISAM socket - socket error %d.
entry.description: The error code is a standard Linux socket error code. Either the socket could not be created or a connection could not be made with the placeholder file path.

entry.name: tspmcredstomap
entry.text: %s
entry.description: Should contain a property to use as userDN to locate roles (LDAP groups)

entry.name: tspmldapsearchresults
entry.text: LDAP search results %s
entry.description: Contains a list of LDAP object DNs, usually groups which contain a member that is the 'userDN' DN

entry.name: tspmsearcherror
entry.text: An error occurred while retrieving groups from LDAP: %s
entry.description: An error message was returned from the LDAP search for the groups with member 'userDN'

entry.name: tspmerrorfindingldapattrforuser
entry.text: Error retrieving LDAP attribute '%1$s' for authenticated user '%2$s'.
entry.description: The search for the LDAP attribute in the 'userDN' entry returned '*ERROR*'

entry.name: tspmusernotauthenticated
entry.text: User is not authenticated.
entry.description: Supplied mapped-credential was for a failed authentication attempt.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the AAA-Policy is configured correctly if the user should have been successfully configured

entry.name: tspmupdateignored
entry.text: Update request ignored as modification of the message has been detected.
entry.description: The signature of a policy update request in a policy distribution update message failed verification.

entry.name: tspmnotificationrejected
entry.text: Incoming message from IBM Security Policy Manager rejected due to invalid signature.
entry.description: The entire policy update message was rejected due to signature failure.

entry.name: tspmpolicyupdatemsg
entry.text: Received notice for context '%1$s' with event type '%2$s' as the result of a message from '%3$s'(%4$s)i. Transaction identifier is '%5$s'.
entry.description: Displays contents of parse of individual update transaction

entry.name: tspminvalidevent
entry.text: The EventType '%s' is not recognized.

entry.name: tspmwrongprotocol
entry.text: Did not recognize the specified update protocol '%s'
entry.description: The protocol name space was not recognized. It should have the value 'http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/ws/2004/09/mex'

entry.name: tspmdialecterror
entry.text: Unknown dialect %s
entry.description: The PolicyDialect property should contain either 'urn:oasis:names:tc:xacml:2.0:policy:schema:os' or 'http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-securitypolicy/200702'

entry.name: tspmserviceadminerror
entry.text: An error occurred while making an internal administrative call: %s
entry.description: An internal call to either clear the local PDP cache, upload the updated policy, create the directory which serves as the cache, or remove a specific policy entry from the cache failed.
entry.suggestion: Check that the actual directory and files which serve as the local cache still exist. Usually they are found in 'local:/tspm/'

entry.name: useemailbadversion
entry.text: The 'use-email-as-user-id' parameter is not valid for TAM V6.0.
entry.description: The parameter was only added to TAMeB at version 6.1.

entry.name: tamhasstarted
entry.text: The ISAM client has started.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client has responded after being started.

entry.name: opstateup
entry.text: The ISAM object is up with status (%d)

entry.name: opstatedown
entry.text: The ISAM object is down with status (%d)

entry.name: removing
entry.text: The ISAM client for object '%s' is being removed.

entry.name: tamlocalmodehosterr
entry.text: A valid local mode host must be provided.
entry.description: In local listening mode the policy server must be able to contact the IBM Security Access Manager client running on the DataPower Gateway. A valid local host name must be provided or the default system name must be present to provide the contact endpoint.
entry.suggestion: Use the System Identifier or a host name that resolves to one of the ethernet interfaces.

entry.name: localportinvalid
entry.text: A valid local port must be provided.
entry.description: In local listening mode the policy server must be able to contact the IBM Security Access Manager client running on the DataPower Gateway. A valid local port name must be provided.

entry.name: tamdbmodemismatch
entry.text: The authorization location mode did not match the configured value.
entry.description: The authorization configuration mode must be provided at IBM Security Access Manager configuration file creation. The current selected mode must match this value.
entry.suggestion: Change the mode to match the value in the 'aznapi-configuration' stanza of the configuration file

entry.name: tambadpollinterval
entry.text: The poll interval is invalid.
entry.description: The poll interval must be greater than 1 second or must be one of the strings 'disable' or 'default'. The interval is the time between requests to the policy server for policy updates. The default is currently 600 seconds. 'disable' turns off polling.
entry.suggestion: Reenter a correct poll interval

entry.name: listenerinternalerr
entry.text: Listen mode could not be changed.
entry.description: This is an internal error.

entry.name: tamchgporterr
entry.text: The attempt to change the listen port failed with reason: %s
entry.description: The listen port needs to be communicated back to the IBM Security Access Manager policy server so it knows where to send the policy update notifications.
entry.suggestion: Check that the IBM Security Access Manager policy server is running and accessible

entry.name: tamchgmodeerr
entry.text: The attempt to change the policy authorization mode failed with reason: %s
entry.description: The policy authorization needs to be communicated back to the IBM Security Access Manager policy server so it knows if it is to send policy update notifications.
entry.suggestion: Check that the IBM Security Access Manager policy server is running and accessible.

entry.name: addedport
entry.text: The listen port was successfully updated to %d.
entry.description: The policy server requires the listener port to know where to send the policy update notifications.

entry.name: addedmode
entry.text: The listen mode was successfully updated to %s.
entry.description: The policy server requires the listen mode to know where if it is to send the policy update notifications.

entry.name: nolocalport
entry.text: Optional local port was not specified for listen mode.
entry.description: A local port is optional here only if the port was specified during IBM Security Access Manager configuration file creation.
entry.suggestion: If a port was not entered during configuration then disable this object, add a local port and restart the object

entry.name: localportreqd
entry.text: A local port value is required for listen mode.
entry.description: If listen mode was enabled at configuration then a local port was also configured. If listen mode is enabled at another time then the local port must be specified.
entry.suggestion: Add a local port and restart the object

entry.name: tamupdatesoff
entry.text: Local policy updates and server policy notifications cannot both be disabled.
entry.description: In local mode the local policy database has to be refreshed. This can be done by setting the database refresh interval to a time larger than 0 seconds which causes updates to be requested at the set interval. It can also be done be having the policy server send notifications of updates. One or both of these methods must be provided.
entry.suggestion: Set the refresh interval to more than 0 seconds or enable policy update notifications.

entry.name: tamdbnomem
entry.text: Insufficient resources to enable local mode policy database.
entry.description: The policy database is stored in memory. Allocating the policy database could possibly exhaust available memory.

entry.name: localportused
entry.text: The selected listen port is in use. Check availability of the port.
entry.description: An attempt was made to bind to the port but this failed. The IBM Security Access Manager task needs to bind to the port to receive notifications from the policy server. This may be a temporary condition if the IBM Security Access Manager client has just been restarted.
entry.suggestion: Select another port and try again.

entry.name: tamregistrymismatch
entry.text: The configuration registry type does not match the selected type.
entry.description: The registry type enabled in the configuration file must match the registry type of the creation options.
entry.suggestion: Recreate the configuration file with the correct registry type.

entry.name: beginadgen
entry.text: Starting Active Directory registry file creation
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager object is creating the Active Directory registry configuration file on the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: noreqadfile
entry.text: An Active Directory LDAP configuration file is required.
entry.description: The multidomain option can only be set if an Active Directory registration file is provided.

entry.name: incompatibleregistry
entry.text: The registry is incompatible with existing enabled ISAM objects.
entry.description: Only IBM Security Access Manager object clients with the same registry type can be enabled at the same time within the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: invalidrastrace
entry.text: The ISAM RAS trace configuration is invalid.
entry.description: This is an internal error. The RAS trace configuration data could not be interpreted.
entry.suggestion: Try re-entering the data in the "ISAM RAS Trace" panel.

entry.name: failedcreaterouting
entry.text: The ISAM routing file could not be created.
entry.description: The tracing configuration for the IBM Security Access Manager client libraries is stored in a routing file which is used during initialization of the ISAM libraries. This file is generated from the information supplied in the ISAM Tracing configuration. This file could not be created in "temporary:".
