entry.suggestion: Check "temporary:" for a routing file for the current IBM Security Access Manager object and delete it if found.

entry.name: failedbuildrouting
entry.text: The ISAM routing file could not be updated.
entry.description: The tracing configuration for the IBM Security Access Manager client libraries is stored in a routing file which is used during initialization of the ISAM libraries. This file is generated from the information supplied in the ISAM Tracing configuration. The file could not be updated because of errors in the configuration data.
entry.suggestion: Check the configuration data that was entered, particularly the component definition format.

entry.name: ldaptraceenabled
entry.text: The LDAP trace is enabled to file temporary:/%1$s/%2$s .

entry.name: gskittraceenabled
entry.text: The GSKit trace is enabled to file temporary:/%1$s/%2$s .

entry.name: tamtraceenabled
entry.text: The ISAM trace is enabled to file temporary:/%1$s/%2$s .

entry.name: pipecreatefail
entry.text: An intermediate file, %s for LDAP trace cannot be created.
entry.description: LDAP trace is piped to the final trace file. The pipe cannot be created.
entry.suggestion: Check that adequate file space exists then try again.

entry.name: notpipefile
entry.text: The intermediate file, %s for LDAP trace is corrupted.
entry.description: LDAP trace is piped to the final trace file. This intermediate file exists but is not a pipe.
entry.suggestion: Re-enable the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: failopenpipe
entry.text: The intermediate file, %s for LDAP trace could not be opened.
entry.description: LDAP trace is piped to the final trace file. This intermediate file exists but could not be opened.
entry.suggestion: Re-enable the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: tracepipeerror
entry.text: An error occurred reading the LDAP trace.
entry.description: LDAP trace is piped to the final trace file. An error occurred reading from the pipe.

entry.name: tracetargeterror
entry.text: An error occurred accessing the LDAP trace file.
entry.description: LDAP trace is piped to the final trace file. An error occurred reading from the pipe.

entry.name: tamldaptracedisabled
entry.text: ISAM LDAP tracing has stopped.
entry.description: Something has caused the IBM Security Access Manager LDAP tracing to stop. This could be an error or more likely the IBM Security Access Manager object is disabled.

entry.name: noldaptracefile
entry.text: The LDAP trace file, %s is not accessible.
entry.description: The LDAP trace file could either not be created or was not writable.

entry.name: notraceevent
entry.text: No event created for ISAM trace completion processing.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager trace completion routine could not be registered during initialization of the ISAM Trace Manager.

entry.name: tracememused
entry.text: Memory that will be allocated for ISAM trace files is %d kB
entry.description: This is the approximate amount of memory that will be used in the temporary: directory to store IBM Security Access Manager trace files. It is calculated from the trace size parameters entered, allowing 2 cyclic files of that size. ISAM trace entries are converted to bytes according to the trace type (XML or other). 50 Mbs is automatically allocated if GSKit trace is enabled.

entry.name: tracenotenomem
entry.text: Not enough memory remains for ISAM trace files. Tracing is disabled.
entry.description: If the IBM Security Access Manager trace files will occupy more that 80% of the remaining DataPower Gateway memory then tracing is disabled.
entry.suggestion: Reduce the trace size on one or more of the enabled libraries or entirely disable trace on a library then try again.

entry.name: retryschedulesuccess
entry.text: ISAM client restart scheduled in %d seconds
entry.description: Following an initial restart failure, the IBM Security Access Manager client was scheduled to restart in the indicated number of seconds.

entry.name: retrydisabled
entry.text: ISAM client restart not scheduled because automatic retries are disabled.
entry.description: Following an initial restart failure, the IBM Security Access Manager client was not scheduled to restart at a future time because the Automatic Retry setting was disabled.
entry.suggestion: Enable Automatic Retries for the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: retryschedulefail
entry.text: ISAM client restart not scheduled because a scheduling failure occurred.
entry.description: Following an initial restart failure, the attempt to schedule a IBM Security Access Manager client restart failed.

entry.name: pauserestart
entry.text: Pausing ISAM client restart.
entry.description: The operational state of IBM Security Access Manager object was changed to down while attempting to restart. This is most likely caused by the domain transitioning to the down state.

entry.name: resumerestart
entry.text: Resuming ISAM client restart.
entry.description: The operational state of IBM Security Access Manager object was returned it its previous state. The object will resume the restart attempt. This is most likely caused by the domain transitioning to the up state.

entry.name: retryconfinvalid
entry.text: ISAM configuration parameter '%s' is invalid.
entry.description: The configuration parameter indicated in the log event message is not within the acceptable range.
entry.suggestion: Review the documentation and update the indicated configuration parameter.

entry.name: ksrefreshstart
entry.text: Starting ISAM keystore password refresh thread.
entry.description: Refresh the password on the IBM Security Access Manager client keystore in case it has expired.

entry.name: ksrefresh
entry.text: Signaling IBM Security Access Manager keystore password refreshing.
entry.description: The keystore password refresh activity is starting.

entry.name: ksrefreshed
entry.text: The keystore password refresh operation was completed successfully.

entry.name: ksnotrefreshed
entry.text: The keystore password refresh operation was not completed successfully.
entry.description: The operations to refresh the keystore password failed.
entry.suggestion: Attempt to regenerate the IBM Security Access Manager configuration.

entry.name: tamobjectneedsenable
entry.text: The keystore password refresh operation cannot be completed for disabled IBM Security Access Manager object '%s'.
entry.description: The operation to refresh the keystore password requires that the IBM Security Access Manager object is enabled since the last DataPower Gateway restart. The object might not have been enabled since that restart.
entry.suggestion: Attempt to re-enable the IBM Security Access Manager object, then try the action again.

entry.name: copylocaldbstart
entry.text: Starting copy local IBM Security Access Manager database.
entry.description: Entering the action to copy and/or remove the local IBM Security Access Manager database.

entry.name: copydbnooperation
entry.text: No operation was selected to apply to the local database.
entry.description: If no operation is selected then the database will remain in place.
entry.suggestion: Try the action again, and select at least one of the operations.

entry.name: notinlocalmode
entry.text: The selected IBM Security Access Manager object is not in local mode.
entry.description: If the object is configured in remote mode then no local database will be present. Note that a remote mode object cannot be reconfigured with local mode. The mode of the object is determined when the IBM Security Access Manager configuration file is created for that object.
entry.suggestion: Try the action again, and select an IBM Security Access Manager object that is configured in local mode.

entry.name: localdbnotcopied
entry.text: The local database copy failed.
entry.description: The operation to copy the local database was attempted but failed.

entry.name: localdbnotremoved
entry.text: The local database removal failed.
entry.description: The operation to remove the local database was attempted but failed.

entry.name: localdbcopied
entry.text: The local database was successfully copied.
entry.description: The local database was successfully copied to 'temporary:'. It may now be transferred off the DataPower Gateway.

entry.name: localdbremoved
entry.text: The local database was successfully removed.
entry.description: The local database was successfully removed.

entry.name: localdbcopiedremoved
entry.text: The local database was successfully copied and removed.
entry.description: The local database was successfully copied to 'temporary:' then the original was removed.

entry.name: removelocaldbfail
entry.text: The attempt to remove the local database failed.
entry.description: The local database could not be deleted.

entry.name: localdbcopy
entry.text: Signalling IBM Security Access Manager local database copy/remove
entry.description: The local database copy activity is starting.

entry.name: tfimnomemendpointtype
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM Endpoint Type field.
entry.description: The value of the mEndpointType property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Retry the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimmissingendpointtype
entry.text: Missing TFIM Endpoint Type.
entry.description: No value was provided for the mEndpointType property.
entry.suggestion: Check the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Endpoint Type was supplied then retry the 'Apply' operation. Contact IBM Support if the problem persists.

entry.name: tfimnomemusername
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM Username field.
entry.description: The value of the username property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Retry the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimnomempassword
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM Password field.
entry.description: The value of the password property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Retry the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tfimnomemvaluetypemode
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM LTPA ValueType Mode field.
entry.description: The value of the LTPA ValueType mode property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Retry the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tammsglogdisabled
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager message logging is disabled.
entry.description: The logging of event messages generated by IBM Security Access Manager has stopped. These events describe actions taking place in the background in the IBM Security Access Manager client.
entry.suggestion: Restart the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: tammsgevnt
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager message returned - '%s'
entry.description: The logging of event messages generated by IBM Security Access Manager is enabled. This message indicates the event that has just been received.
entry.suggestion: A description of the event can be found in the 'Troubleshooting information' section of the 'Access Manager for e-business' Knowledge Center.

entry.name: nomsgevntparams
entry.text: The parameters for the IBM Security Access Manager event message logging did not initialize.
entry.description: The interface for the event message logging could not be initialized.

entry.name: msgevntparamsok
entry.text: The parameters for the IBM Security Access Manager event message logging are initialized.
entry.description: The interface for the event message logging was initialized.

entry.name: userdnnotavail
entry.text: The User DN is not available, the short name %s is being used for IBM Security Access Manager authorization.
entry.description: The short name is used for authorizations if the registry type is Active Directory. It is not an error in this case if the DN is not provided.

entry.name: userdnnotused
entry.text: The User DN is not used for IBM Security Access Manager authorization when PAC use is enabled.
entry.description: Even if a User DN or short name is provided during authentication it will not be used during authorization if a PAC is being used.

entry.name: tamlocaldbreaderr
entry.text: The read of the original local policy database failed during copy - copied %zd bytes.
entry.description: An internal read error occurred when attempting to copy the IBM Security Access Manager local database.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: tamlocaldbwriteerr
entry.text: The write to the destination local policy database failed during copy - copied %zd bytes.
entry.description: An internal write error occurred when attempting to copy the IBM Security Access Manager local database.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: tamlocaldbreadwarn
entry.text: The first read of the original local policy database failed during copy - copied %zd bytes - retrying...
entry.description: An internal read error occurred while attempting to copy the IBM Security Access Manager local database. The DataPower Gateway will attempt another copy operation.

entry.name: tamlibloopfsf
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager library open failed with error %1$d, %2$s.

entry.name: tamlibloopdev
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager library loopback open failed with error %1$d, %2$s.

entry.name: tamlibassocfail
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager library association failed with error %1$d, %2$s.

entry.name: tamlibloopstatusfail
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager library loop status failed with error %1$d, %2$s.

entry.name: tamlibloopclosefail
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager library loop close failed with error %1$d, %2$s.

entry.name: tamlibfileclosefail

entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager client was started but has not responded within the preset time.
entry.suggestion: Disable then re-enable the IBM Security Access Manager client

entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager obfuscation file

entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client Active Directory configuration file

entry.name: tamldaptraceend
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager LDAP trace endpoint
entry.description: The access point for communicating with the LDAP trace client.

entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager message event endpoint
entry.description: The access point for communicating with the message event client.

entry.name: versionmismatch
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager configured version does not match licensed version.
entry.description: The [meta-info] stanza in the IBM Security Access Manager configuration file contains a version entry. This version does not match the version licensed for this firmware.
entry.suggestion: Check that the configuration file was registered with the version of IBM Security Access Manager that is licensed for this firmware.

entry.name: chrootlinkfail
entry.text: Internal file linkage error with file - %s.
entry.description: An unexpected internal error occurred in the file system during the manipulation of the file.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: chrootkeymountfail
entry.text: Internal keyfile path linkage error.
entry.description: An unexpected internal error occurred in the file system during the manipulation of the keyfile path.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: chroottracemountfail
entry.text: Internal trace path linkage error.ISAM and GSKit tracing disabled.
entry.description: An unexpected internal error occurred in the file system during the manipulation of the tracefile path.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: umountfail
entry.text: Internal directory linkage error.
entry.description: An unexpected internal error occurred in the file system during the manipulation of a directory.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: fixedversionupgrade
entry.text: The version of IBM Security Access Manager configuration file is upgraded to match the licensed version.
entry.description: The [meta-info] stanza in the IBM Security Access Manager configuration file contains a version entry. This version is earlier then the version licensed for this firmware. In order to enable the IBM Security Access Manager client the configuration file version will be changed to the licensed version. This upgrade is temporary while the IBM Security Access Manager client is enabled.
entry.suggestion: If there have been any optional stanza entries added to the configuration file check that they are still valid in the upgraded version of IBM Security Access Manager.

entry.name: objversionmismatch
entry.text: The selected IBM Security Access Manager version does not match licensed version so is ignored.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager version selected for the client configuration should either be "Default" or the licensed version. Any other version selected is invalid and will cause this property to be ignored.
entry.suggestion: Optionally select "Default" as the value for this property.

entry.name: versionupgrade
entry.text: The configuration file version will be upgraded to the selected IBM Security Access Manager version.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager version selected for the client configuration is later than the version in the [meta-info] stanza of the configuration file. The configuration file version will be updated and the IBM Security Access Manager client will be enabled with this version.
entry.suggestion: If this upgrade is not required then select "Default" as the IBM Security Access Manager client configured version.

entry.name: nodowngrade
entry.text: A version downgrade of a IBM Security Access Manager client is not permitted. The value in the client configuration file will be ignored.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager version selected for the client configuration is earlier than the version in the [meta-info] stanza of the configuration file. The configuration file version will be maintained and the IBM Security Access Manager client will be enabled with this version.
entry.suggestion: If a downgrade is required, contact IBM Support.

entry.name: tamversionmismatch
entry.text: The IBM Security Access Manager version selected is different to the version on the DataPower Gateway.
entry.description: The IBM Security Access Manager version selection is redundant on this DataPower Gateway, as it supports only a single version as specified in the firmware. The version in the firmware will be used.
entry.suggestion: If the IBM Security Access Manager version installed on the DataPower Gateway is not correct, then the wrong firmware was loaded.

entry.name: dpfipswofips
entry.text: An IBM Security Access Manager FIPS mode is not enabled but the DataPower Gateway is in FIPS mode.
entry.description: If FIPS mode is enabled for the DataPower Gateway then it is best practice that a FIPS mode should be set for the ISAM client as well.
entry.suggestion: Enable an appropriate FIPS or NIST mode for this ISAM client.

entry.name: tfimnomempasswordalias
entry.text: Not enough memory for copying TFIM Password Alias field.
entry.description: The value of the password alias property could not be copied because of insufficient memory.
entry.suggestion: The DataPower Gateway has temporarily exhausted memory. Try the 'Apply' operation later.

entry.name: tam_pipecreatefail
entry.text: An intermediate file, %1$s for ISAM client trace could not be created.
entry.description: IBM Access Manager client trace is piped to the final trace file. The pipe could not be created.
entry.suggestion: Check that adequate file space exists then try again.

entry.name: tam_notpipefile
entry.text: The intermediate file, %1$s for ISAM client trace is corrupted.
entry.description: IBM Access Manager client trace is piped to the final trace file. This intermediate file exists but is not a pipe.
entry.suggestion: Reenable the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: tam_failopenpipe
entry.text: The intermediate file, %1$s for ISAM client trace could not be opened.
entry.description: IBM Access Manager client trace is piped to the final trace file. This intermediate file exists but could not be opened.
entry.suggestion: Reenable the IBM Security Access Manager object.

entry.name: adinvalid
entry.text: The Microsoft Active Directory registry type is not valid for ISAM version 8.0.1 and later clients.
entry.description: The Active Directory registry type accessed Active Directory Service Interfaces by using LDAP. This specialized interface is no longer supported for ISAM version 8.0.1 and later clients.
entry.suggestion: Use LDAP over the Active Directory Application mode that is compatible with the LDAP registry type. Enable the Active Directory Application mode on the Active Directory deployment and select the LDAP registry type.

entry.name: tamcliregconfig
entry.text: IBM Security Access Manager client registry configuration file
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: invalidsuffix
entry.text: A search suffix is not in DN format.
entry.description: An LDAP search suffix cannot be added to a list of suffixes because it is not in the LDAP distinguished name format. The list will be created but this suffix will not be added to the running configuration.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the entered LDAP search suffix is in the LDAP distinguished name format.

entry.name: nosuffix
entry.text: A search suffix is invalid.
entry.description: An LDAP search suffix cannot be added to a list of suffixes because it is not recognized. The list will be created but this suffix will not be added to the running configuration.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the LDAP search suffix configuration is entered correctly.

entry.name: createdsuffixes
entry.text: %1$d LDAP search suffixes are configured.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: searchsuffixes
entry.text: All LDAP directory suffixes will be searched for users.
entry.description: No LDAP search suffixes are provided, so all the suffixes, including the suffixes in all federated directories will be searched for users.

entry.name: createdfederates
entry.text: %1$d Federated directories configured.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: invalidfederate
entry.text: Invalid federated directory property is found.
entry.description: A federated directory has invalid configuration. An expected property is absent or has the wrong format.
entry.suggestion: Check that the directory host and port settings are valid and that all suffixes have the correct DN format.

entry.name: createdfedsuffixes
entry.text: %1$d Federated directory suffix %2$s is configured.
entry.description: The suffixes for this federated directory are configured.

entry.name: createdsuffix
entry.text: %1$d LDAP search suffix is configured.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: createdfederate
entry.text: %1$d Federated directory configured.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: createdreplica
entry.text: %1$d authorization replica configured.
entry.description: An authorization replica was configured for the IBM Security Access Manager client.

entry.name: nocreatresolver
entry.text: Error copying resolver information.
entry.description: Resolver information could not be obtained from the DataPower Gateway for the local operation.
entry.suggestion: Internal error.Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: nocreatswitch
entry.text: Error copying switcher information.
entry.description: Switcher information could not be obtained from the DataPower Gateway for the local operation.
entry.suggestion: Internal error.Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: nocreathosts
entry.text: Error copying hosts information.
entry.description: Host information could not be obtained from the DataPower Gateway for the local operation.
entry.suggestion: Internal error.Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: clientcacerterr
entry.text: Error copying CA cert.
entry.summary: Error copying ISAM Policy Server root CA cert to Access Manager client filesystem.
entry.description: Failed to make a copy of the root CA certificate for the client. Each Access Manager client needs the root CA cert pdcacert.b64 as part of its runtime.
entry.suggestion: Try refreshing the Access Manager client certificate.

entry.name: chrootkeycopyfail
entry.text: Internal copy error on keyfile - %s.
entry.description: An unexpected internal error occurred in the file system during the manipulation of the keyfile path.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: initnobasecontext
entry.text: *Cannot initialize an instance when its base security context '%1$s' is not available. Error: %2$s*
entry.description: You can use the dp ext function to issue a security context instance, but the base security context must be available in the STS system.
entry.suggestion: The base context was not created successfully or the old security context in the request message has expired and exceeded the time waiting for a renewal, hence the system has removed it completely. Create a new security context.

entry.name: initexistingcontext
entry.text: *The security context '%s' is already created. Cannot re-init an active security context or instance.*
entry.description: When a security context or instance has created, actively started and is not expired, the security context info can not be changed by reinitialization. Check your parameters, which might be same as the one you used to create the existing security context. You should use the dp ext function to safely modify some of the security context info if that is what you need.
entry.suggestion: The security context ID and/or Instance parameter might be wrong. You can pass in an empty context id parameter to generate a new security context, the system will assign a unique context id automatically.

entry.name: contextusesskey
entry.text: Directly use the input CryptoSharedSecret object '%1$s' as the key for security context '%2$s'

entry.name: contextnosskey
entry.text: *Cannot resolve the Shared Secret Key '%s'*
entry.description: The Crypto SSKey object is not available. Cannot set up security context.

entry.name: contextusekey
entry.text: Directly use the input key material as the shared secret for security context '%s'
entry.description: The input key material is base64 encoded.

entry.name: contextuserandomkey
entry.text: Generate a random shared secret key with algorithm '%1$s' for the security context '%2$s'.

entry.name: contextnokey
entry.text: *Cannot initialize security context/instance '%s' when key material is not resolved.*
entry.description: The shared secret is required in order to set up a security context successfully, but the input key mode and materials are not resolved as the shared secret key.

entry.name: contextbadb64key
entry.text: *The key material for security context '%s' is not properly base64 encoded.*
entry.description: The input key material is not base64 encoded.
entry.suggestion: Base64 encode the key and call the function again.

entry.name: nosystemexpiry
entry.text: The system-wide AAA expiry variable is not set.
entry.suggestion: You may set the system wide AAA default expiry by using system variable var:///system/AAA/defaultexpiry.

entry.name: usesystemexpiry
entry.text: The system-wide AAA expiry variable is set '%s'.

entry.name: usedefaultsystemexpiry
entry.text: Use the default expiry value.
entry.suggestion: You may set the system wide AAA default expiry by using system variable var:///system/AAA/defaultexpiry.

entry.name: contextcacheerror
entry.text: *Cannot cache the security context '%s', cache is full or out of memory.*
entry.description: The security context is initialized successfully, but it can not be kept in the system, the security context can not be used for further transactions.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: contextusebasekey
entry.text: Use the shared secret from base security context '%1$s' to initialize instance '%2$s'.

entry.name: contextusecurrenttime
entry.text: The created time is not specified, use the current time for security context '%s'.

entry.name: renewnobasecontext
entry.text: *Cannot create an instance when its base security context '%s' is not available to renew.*
entry.description: It is allowed to issue a security context instance by a WS-SC renew request, but the base security context should be still in the STS system.
entry.suggestion: The old security context in the request message has expired and exceeded the time waiting for a renewal, hence the system has removed it completely. Create a new security context.

entry.name: notrenewable
entry.text: *The security context '%s' is not renewable.*
entry.description: The security context is not allowed to renew.
entry.suggestion: You can call the ext function dp:aaa-set-context-info('transaction-renew', '1') to make it renewable, or change the AAA Policy to make newly issued security contexts renewable.

entry.name: contextcreated
entry.text: Security context '%s' is created successfully.

entry.name: contextrenewed
entry.text: Security context '%s' is renewed successfully.

entry.name: contextinstancecancelled
entry.text: The security context '%1$s' instance '%2$s' is deleted.

entry.name: emptyextfuncparam
entry.text: *Cannot call '%s()' with some empty arguments.*
entry.description: The required arguments, such as context id or context info name, can not be NULL or empty string.

entry.name: nosecuritycontext
entry.text: *The security context (id: '%1$s', instance: '%2$s') is not available.*
entry.description: Cannot retrieve the security context from cache.
entry.suggestion: The old security context in the request message may have expired and exceeded the time waiting for a renewal, hence the system has removed it completely. Create a new security context, and set its renewal wait time longer.

entry.name: contextinfonotset
entry.text: *The security context info '%s' is unknown or read only.*
entry.description: Cannot set the context info.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the context info name is correct.

entry.name: contextinfonotget
entry.text: *The security context info '%s' is unknown.*
entry.description: Cannot get the context info.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the context info name is correct.

entry.name: contextcancelled
entry.text: The security context '%s' and all its instances are deleted.

entry.name: wsscextcallfailed
entry.text: *Failed to run '%1$s()'. Error message: '%2$s'.*
entry.suggestion: Make sure the parameters are correct, and the security context is still active.

entry.name: initnokeymaterial
entry.text: There is no key material to use for security context/instance '%s', generate a random key for the default mode.
entry.description: The shared secret is required in order to set up a security context successfully, but it can not get the key material from a base security context. When the input key mode is zero, a generated random key for this call then be used.
entry.suggestion: Correct the "mode" to be not 0 as there is no base Security Context available.

entry.name: sct_cancelled

entry.description: The Security Context Token will be cancelled.

entry.name: failed_sct_key_derivation

entry.description: Failed to derive a key material.

entry.name: enckey

entry.name: operation_failed

entry.name: could_not_init_digest

entry.text: Encryption key must be rsa
entry.description: The key type for encryption operations must be rsa. dsa and other key types are not supported for this operation.

entry.name: sign_unsupported_key_type
entry.text: Signing key type not supported
entry.description: The key type for signing operations must be rsa (required for sha-1 digest), dsa, or elliptic curve.

entry.name: banned_encryption_algorithm_encrypt
entry.text: Encountered banned encryption algorithm %s while encrypting data.
entry.description: Some crypto modes like FIPS 140-2 Level 1 ban certain encryption algorithms like DES. This message indicates that we attempted to do an encrypt operation with an encryption algorithm that is banned in the current crypto mode.
entry.suggestion: Use an encryption algorithm (like AES) that is allowed in the current crypto mode or switch the Crypto Mode to Permissive.

entry.name: banned_encryption_algorithm_decrypt
entry.text: Encountered banned encryption algorithm while decrypting data.
entry.description: Some crypto modes like FIPS 140-2 Level 1 ban certain encryption algorithms like DES. This message indicates that we attempted to do a decrypt operation with an encryption algorithm that is banned in the current crypto mode.
entry.suggestion: Use an encryption algorithm (like AES) that is allowed in the current crypto mode or switch the Crypto Mode to Permissive.

entry.name: banned_digest_algorithm_verify
entry.text: Encountered banned digest algorithm %s while verifying data.
entry.description: Some crypto modes like FIPS 140-2 Level 1 ban certain digest algorithms like MD5. This message indicates that we attempted to do a verify operation with a digest algorithm that is banned in the current crypto mode.
entry.suggestion: Use a digest algorithm (like SHA-1) that is allowed in the current crypto mode or switch the Crypto Mode to Permissive.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_missingaccesstoken
entry.text: access_token is missing or empty
entry.description: The request either did not contain an access_token, or the access_token was empty.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the client sent a value for access_token, and the value was provided in a supported manner.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_duplicaterequiredparam
entry.text: Illegal duplicate parameter
entry.description: A required parameter was provided more than once.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that all required OAuth parameters are provided exactly once, and that none of the parameters appear in both the POST body and URL query.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_err_invalidstatus
entry.text: Cannot process response from TFIM OAuth STS %s. Invalid status code.
entry.description: The status code extracted from the RSTR was not valid.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Endpoint object is configured with the correct compatibility mode, and that the response from the TFIM server was a valid WS-Trust RSTR.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_err_invalidauthz
entry.text: Cannot process response from TFIM OAuth STS %s. Invalid authorization response.
entry.description: The authorization decision extracted from the RSTR was not valid.
entry.suggestion: Ensure the response from the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server was valid.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_err_notauthz
entry.text: Request not authorized
entry.description: The Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server returned a not authorizated decision.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_invalidendpointtype
entry.text: TFIM Endpoint, %s, provided for OAuth authorization, but is not an OAuth STS type endpoint.
entry.description: The Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Endpoint object provided was not configured as an OAuth STS.
entry.suggestion: Ensure the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Endpoint configured in the AAA policy's authorization step is the correct type.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_invalidcompat
entry.text: TFIM Endpoint, %s, provided is configured with an invalid compatibility mode.
entry.description: The compatibility mode configure for Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint object is not valid for OAuth type endpoints. The specified default compatibility mode will be used instead.
entry.suggestion: Reconfigure the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager Endpoint object to use a valid compatibility mode.

entry.name: az_oauth_tfim_connectfailed

entry.suggestion: Ensure the server address and port are correct. See the logs for additional details.

entry.name: dynamic_config_nomerge
entry.text: The merge-config element is disabled in dynamic configuration custom URL %s.
entry.description: In the output that the dynamic configuration custom URL returns, the merge-config element is disabled. The custom URL is expected to return the complete set of AAA policy properties.

entry.name: dynamic_config_invalid
entry.text: Dynamic configuration custom URL %s returned an invalid output.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Refer to the sample stylesheet for a valid success or failure output.

entry.name: dynamic_config_validation_enabled
entry.text: Configuration validation is not disabled in dynamic configuration custom URL '%s'. This can degrade performance in production environments.
entry.description: Configuration validation is not disabled in the output that the custom URL returns. This can have an impact on performance in production environments.
entry.suggestion: After you test the custom process and before you deploy to production, ensure that you disable configuration validation by setting the valid-config element to off in the output that the custom URL returns. See the sample stylesheet.

entry.name: dynamic_config_validation_failed
entry.text: Dynamic configuration custom URL '%s' returned an invalid configuration '%s'.
entry.description: The dynamic configuration custom URL returned an invalid configuration. The properties that the custom URL returns overwrite the properties that are defined in the template AAA. The effective AAA configuration fails to validate due to missing or incorrect properties.
entry.suggestion: Refer to the context variable var://context/AAA/dynamic-aaa-config to look at the effective AAA configuration that is generated as a result of merging the template AAA and the output that the custom URL returns. Fix the missing or incorrect properties.

entry.name: dynamic_config_validation_success
entry.text: The configuration that is returned by custom URL '%s' is validated successfully.

entry.name: dynamic_config_modified_props
entry.text: The AAA dynamic configuration that is processed by custom URL '%s' modified the following properties: %s
entry.suggestion: Refer to the context variable var://context/AAA/dynamic-aaa-config for the complete effective AAA dynamic configuration that is used for the transaction.

entry.name: bad_saml_hok_cache
entry.text: The SAML HoK Token is not cached from the recipient
entry.description: The SAML HoK Token from the recipient should have been processed and cached by the DataPower request message processing, but that seems not happening.
entry.suggestion: Check the configuration of the request rule, make sure either the verify or decrypt action has set configuration "WS-Security 1.1: EncryptedKeySHA1 Cache Lifetime for the Extracted Token" with a non-zero value. Or check if the input message to DataPower really used the SAML HoK to wrap up the EncryptedKey.

entry.name: incorrect_key_length

entry.description: The algorithm used requires a correct key length in bits.
entry.suggestion: Use the correct key length for selected algorithm.

entry.name: invalid_key_object_name

entry.description: The configured object does not exist or is not available in the current domain.
entry.suggestion: Check configured key object.

entry.name: incorrect_iv_length

entry.description: The initialization vector's length is incorrect.
entry.suggestion: Check documentation for details.

entry.name: cipher_failed
entry.text: Cipher failed
entry.description: The cipher operation failed.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: cipher_empty_data
entry.text: Performing cipher with empty data.
entry.description: Not able to perform the cipher against zero-length data
entry.suggestion: Be sure the cipher data is not empty.

entry.name: decipher_failed_no_authtag
entry.text: Decipher failed. An valid authentication tag is needed
entry.description: The decipher algorithm you specified needs a valid authentication tag to do an integrity check.
entry.suggestion: Call the setAuthTag() method using valid authentication tag data before calling the final() method.

entry.name: decipher_failed_mac_failed
entry.text: Decipher failed during the integrity check
entry.description: The decipher failed during the integrity check.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: incorrect_authtag_length
entry.text: The authentication tag's length is incorrect. The length is '%1$lu' bits
entry.description: The authentication ag's length is incorrect.
entry.suggestion: Check documentation for details.

entry.name: decipher_failed_on_integrity_check
entry.text: Decipher failed because of an incorrect authentication tag
entry.description: The decipher failed during the integrity check. The authentication tag is incorrect
entry.suggestion: Verify that the authentication tag is correct, and perform the decipher again.

entry.name: verify_empty_sig
entry.text: Performing verify with an empty signature.
entry.description: Not able to perform the verify against a zero-length signature
entry.suggestion: Be sure the signature is not empty.

entry.name: decipher_empty_data
entry.text: Performing decipher with empty data.
entry.description: Not able to perform the decipher against zero-length data
entry.suggestion: Be sure the decipher data is not empty.

entry.name: incorrect_keyobject
entry.text: The key object must be a string, Buffer, Buffers, valid JWK or Object which contains a 'key' property and an optional 'passphrase' property
entry.description: A key object could be a string, Buffer, Buffers, valid JWK or Object which contains 'key' and 'passphrase' properties. For Object case, the value of 'key' property is a Buffer or Buffers and the value of 'passphrase' is a string.
entry.suggestion: Check the documentation for the key object in crypto module. Check the documentation for the JWK in jwk module.

entry.name: incorrect_passphrase_prop_keyobject
entry.text: The 'passphrase' property of the key object is ignored
entry.description: The 'passphrase' property of the key object is ignored.
entry.suggestion: The passphrase property is unnecessary for a shared secret key or a public key.

entry.name: base64url_decode_fail
entry.text: Failed to do a base64url decode against the data
entry.description: Base64url decode failed. The base64url encoded data is incorrect.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the base64url encoded data is correct.

entry.name: incorrect_jws_jwe_input_format
entry.text: The data format for JOSE parse() is incorrect.
entry.description: The data format is not correct for JOSE parse().
entry.suggestion: Verify that the data format is correct.

entry.name: jose_header_param_not_exist
entry.text: The '%1$s' Header Parameter is not present in the %2$s object.
entry.description: The Header Parameter must be present.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the data is correct.

entry.name: jose_key_must_exist
entry.text: The key object is not specified. A key object is necessary for %1$s.
entry.description: A key object is required for Key Management.
entry.suggestion: Check the documentation on how to set a key object.

entry.name: jose_dir_encrypted_key_not_null
entry.text: Direct Encryption is employed but the encrypted key is not empty.
entry.description: Direct Encryption is employed. The encrypted key must be empty.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the data is correct.

entry.name: jose_unsupported_alg
entry.text: Unsupported alg value %1$s for %2$s
entry.description: The algorithm value is unsupported.
entry.suggestion: Check the documentation for the supported algorithms.

entry.name: jwe_json_recipients_dir_mix
entry.text: Recipients in the JWE object cannot have the 'dir' algorithm co-exist with other algorithm values
entry.description: Recipients in JWE object cannot have the 'dir' algorithm co-exist with other algorithm values, such as 'RSA1_5'.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWE object is correct.

entry.name: jwe_ciphertext_empty
entry.text: The Ciphertext in the JWE object cannot be empty
entry.description: The Ciphertext in the JWE object cannot be empty.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWE object is correct.

entry.name: jwe_json_set_dir_key_api
entry.text: %1$s can only be called when algorithm in a Protected Header or Shared Unprotected Header is 'dir'
entry.description: This API call can only be called when the 'dir' algorithm is in a Protected Header or Shared Unprotected Header.
entry.suggestion: Check the documentation for how to call the API.

entry.name: jwe_decrypt_cek_integrity_check_fail
entry.text: The integrity check against the CEK failed. The CEK value calculated from multiple recipients should be consistent
entry.description: The CEK value calculated from multiple recipients should be consistent.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWE object is correct, or verify that the key for each recipient is correct.

entry.name: jwe_json_shared_key_recipient_key_co_exist
entry.text: The recipient has a key object while a shared key object also exists
entry.description: The key object cannot be set per-recipient and in a shared key object at the same time.
entry.suggestion: Remove one key object from one recipient or the shared object.

entry.name: jose_header_param_duplicated
entry.text: The Header Parameter name '%1$s' is duplicated
entry.description: The JOSE Header must not contain duplicate Header Parameter names.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWE object is correct.

entry.name: jwe_alg_header_exists_in_shared_hdrs
entry.text: The 'alg' Header Parameter already exists in Protected Header or Shared Unprotected Header
entry.description: JOSE Header must not contain duplicate Header Parameter names.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWE object is correct.

entry.name: jwe_alg_header_exists_in_recipient_hdrs
entry.text: The 'alg' Header Parameter already exists in the Per-Recipient Unprotected Header
entry.description: JOSE Header must not contain duplicate Header Parameter names.
entry.suggestion: Check if the JWE object is correct.

entry.name: jwe_dir_alg_needs_identical_key
entry.text: The 'dir' algorithm requires an identical symmetric key for every recipient
entry.description: The 'dir' algorithm requires an identical symmetric key for every recipient.
entry.suggestion: Ensure an identical key is used for every recipient.

entry.name: jwe_require_hdr_in_shared_hdr
entry.text: A '%1$s' Header Parameter in Protected Header or Shared Unprotected Header is required
entry.description: A specific Header Parameter is required when calling this method.
entry.suggestion: Assign the prerequisite header parameter first.

entry.name: jwe_dir_alg_set_key_for_recipient
entry.text: When an 'alg' Header Parameter exists in a Protected or Shared Unprotected Header and its value equals 'dir', setting a key for an individual recipient is not permitted
entry.description: The 'dir' algorithm requires an identical symmetric key for every recipient.
entry.suggestion: Do not assign a key for an individual recipient when using the 'dir' algorithm.

entry.name: jwe_set_dir_alg_first
entry.text: When calling addRecipient() with an Unprotected Header argument, 'alg' Header Parameter must exist in a Protected or Shared Unprotected Header and its value must be 'dir'
entry.description: When calling addRecipient() with an Unprotected Header argument, 'alg' Header Parameter must exist in a Protected or Shared Unprotected Header and its value must be 'dir'.
entry.suggestion: Call setAlg('dir', key) first.

entry.name: jwe_no_key_for_recipient
entry.text: One of the recipient missed a key for Key Encryption or Key Wrapping
entry.description: A key is needed for every recipient when doing Key Encryption or Key Wrapping.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that every recipient has a key or use the 'dir' algorithm with a single symmetric key.

entry.name: jwe_decrypt_no_recipient_validate
entry.text: At least one recipient must be successfully validated
entry.description: At least one recipient must be successfully validated or the JWE must be rejected.
entry.suggestion: Call a per-recipient setIntegerityCheck() to do a validatation against the recipient.

entry.name: jws_header_param_duplicated
entry.text: The Header Parameter name '%1$s' is duplicated
entry.description: JWS Protected and Unprotected Header must not contain duplicate Header Parameter names.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWS Header object is correct.

entry.name: jws_sign_parm_missing
entry.text: The sign operation failed with the missing required Header Parameter: '%1$s'
entry.description: When calling sign() the specified parameter must exist in a Protected or Unprotected Header.
entry.suggestion: Call setProtected() or setUnprotected() first to set the required Header Parameter value.

entry.name: jws_compact_single_header
entry.text: The sign operation failed with multiple JWSHeaders
entry.description: The JWS Compact Serialization supports only a single Protected Header.
entry.suggestion: Call sign() with only a single JWSHeader if the 'compact' output is required; otherwise specify the 'json' outputFormat.

entry.name: jws_compact_unprotected_header
entry.text: The sign operation failed with a JWSHeader Unprotected Header
entry.description: The JWS Compact Serialization does not support using an Unprotected Header.
entry.suggestion: Call sign() with only a single JWSHeader containing a Protected Header if 'compact' output is required; otherwise specify the 'json' outputFormat.

entry.name: jws_validate_parm_missing
entry.text: The validate operation failed with the missing required Header Parameter: '%1$s'
entry.description: When calling validate() the specified parameter must exist in a Protected or Unprotected header of the JWS.
entry.suggestion: Check if the JWS object is correct.

entry.name: jws_zero_validations
entry.text: No JWS Signature Validations were requested.
entry.description: At least one JWS signature value must successfully validate or the JWS must be rejected.
entry.suggestion: Select one of the signatures for validation.

entry.name: jws_hmac_validation_failed
entry.text: JWS HMAC Validation Failed
entry.description: Validation of the JWS HMAC Signature failed.
entry.suggestion: Check if the JWS object or key provided is correct.

entry.name: jose_verify_no_signature_in_payload
entry.text: There is no JWS signature in the payload
entry.description: Cannot verify the JWS object if there is no JWS signature in the payload.
entry.suggestion: Check if the JWS object is correct.

entry.name: jose_verify_signature_not_matched
entry.text: One of the signatures does not match any JOSE Signature Identifier object
entry.description: One of the signatures does not match any JOSE Signature Identifier object.
entry.suggestion: All signatures must be specified in JOSE Signature Identifier objects. Add the required JOSE Signature Identifier object.

entry.name: jose_verify_association_not_used
entry.text: One of the JOSE Signature Identifier objects is not used
entry.description: One of the JOSE Signature Identifier objects is not used.
entry.suggestion: All JOSE Signature Identifier objects must match at least one signature. Remove the unnecessary JOSE Signature Identifier object.

entry.name: jose_decrypt_no_association
entry.text: No JOSE Recipient Identifier object matched
entry.description: Decryption fails if there is no JOSE Recipient Identifier object matched.
entry.suggestion: At least one JOSE Recipient Identifier object must be used for decryption. Add the necessary JOSE Recipient Identifier object.

entry.name: jose_verify_association_duplicated
entry.text: The JOSE Signature Identifier object %1$s Header Parameter is duplicated.
entry.description: The JOSE Signature Identifier object Header Parameter is duplicated with other JOSE Signature Identifier object. This JOSE Signature Identifier object is not used.
entry.suggestion: Check all JOSE Signature Identifier objects Header Parameter and remove duplicated one.

entry.name: invalid_compress_algorithm
entry.text: Compression algorithm '%1$s' is invalid
entry.description: The algorithm specified is either invalid or not supported.
entry.suggestion: Please check the documentation for the supported compression algorithms.

entry.name: integrity_protected_header
entry.text: Header '%1$s' cannot be set to unprotected header.
entry.description: The header value must be integrity protected. It must be set to protected header.
entry.suggestion: Move the header from unprotected header to protected header.

entry.name: action_type_not_match
entry.text: The script '%1$s' only applies to action '%2$s'.
entry.description: The script only applies to a specific action because it requires access to the action properties.
entry.suggestion: Use the script in the right action type.

entry.name: crit_must_be_list
entry.text: The value of 'crit' must be an array.
entry.description: The value of 'crit' must be an array.
entry.suggestion: Remove the incorrect 'crit' value.

entry.name: crit_cannot_be_empty_list
entry.text: The value of 'crit' must not be an empty array.
entry.description: The value of 'crit' must not be an empty array.
entry.suggestion: Remove the incorrect 'crit' value.

entry.name: crit_list_duplicated
entry.text: The name '%1$s' in 'crit' list is duplicated
entry.description: The 'crit' list contains duplicate names.
entry.suggestion: Remove the duplicate names or verify the input is correct.

entry.name: crit_elements_must_exist
entry.text: The name '%1$s' in the 'crit' list must exist in the JOSE header
entry.description: All names in the 'crit' list must exist in the JOSE header.
entry.suggestion: Add names to the JOSE header or verify the input is correct.

entry.name: jwe_compact_single_recipient
entry.text: The encrypt operation failed with multiple JWEHeader Recipients
entry.description: The JWE Compact Serialization supports only a single JWEHeader Recipient.
entry.suggestion: Call encrypt() with only a JWEHeader containing no additional JWERecipients if the 'compact' output is required; otherwise specify the 'json' outputFormat.

entry.name: jwe_compact_unprotected_header
entry.text: The encrypt operation failed with a JWEHeader Unprotected Header
entry.description: The JWE Compact Serialization does not support using an Unprotected Header.
entry.suggestion: Call encrypt() with only a single JWEHeader containing a Protected Header if 'compact' output is required; otherwise specify the 'json' outputFormat.

entry.name: randombytes_too_long
entry.text: The size for random bytes exceeds the limitation: %1$d (max:%2$d)
entry.description: The size for random bytes exceeds the limitation.
entry.suggestion: Reduce the size and try again.

entry.name: randombytes_failed
entry.text: Failed to generate random bytes: %1$s
entry.description: Failed to generate random bytes.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM support.

entry.name: jose_compact_not_support_unprotected_header
entry.text: An unprotected header is not allowed when serialization is Compact.
entry.description: An unprotected header is not allowed when serialization is Compact.
entry.suggestion: Remove the unprotected header value.

entry.name: jose_associations_need_match_condition
entry.text: An Associations object requires at least one match condition.
entry.description: An Associations object requires at least one match condition.
entry.suggestion: Add the match condition.

entry.name: jose_header_must_configured_by_property
entry.text: The header name '%1$s' must be configured via a property.
entry.description: The header name must be configured via a property. It cannot be manually added to a JOSE header.
entry.suggestion: Remove the header name.

entry.name: crit_elements_must_exist_and_comma_separated
entry.text: The name '%1$s' in the 'crit' list must exist in the JOSE header. The format of the 'crit' value must be comma separated to set multiple elements.
entry.description: All names in the 'crit' list must exist in the JOSE header and the format for the 'crit' value must be comma separated to set multiple elements.
entry.suggestion: Add names to the JOSE header or verify that the input is correct.

entry.name: crit_element_has_registered_header
entry.text: The name '%1$s' in the 'crit' list is a registered Header Parameter.
entry.description: The 'crit' list must not contain any registered header parameters.
entry.suggestion: Remove the name from the 'crit' list.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_claim_type
entry.text: Incorrect JWT claim type detected '%1$s'. Expected type: %2$s. Actual type: %3$s.
entry.description: The JWT claim type is invalid
entry.suggestion: Verify that the data provided is the expected type. Refer to the JWT standards for the required data type definition.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_encode_op
entry.text: Incorrect JWT Encoder operation '%1$s' provided to the addOperation() function. Valid operations are 'sign' and 'encrypt'.
entry.description: The operation is not supported by the JWT Encoder API.
entry.suggestion: Use the supported JWT Encoder operation value ('sign' or 'encrypt') in the JWT addOperation() function.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_decode_op
entry.text: Incorrect JWT Decoder operation '%1$s' provided to the addOperation() function. Valid operations are 'verify' and 'decrypt'.
entry.description: The operation is not supported by the JWT Decoder API.
entry.suggestion: Use the supported JWT Decoder operation value ('verify' or 'decrypt') in the JWT addOperation() function.

entry.name: implicit_jwt_cty
entry.text: 'cty=JWT'header value is implicitly set to the JOSE protected header.
entry.description: A nested JWT requires the 'cty' header value set to 'JWT'.
entry.suggestion: Modify the code and set the JOSE 'cty' protected header value to 'JWT'.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_cty
entry.text: Incorrect JWT 'cty' header value. Expected: %1$s. Actual: %2$s.
entry.description: A nested JWT requires the 'cty' header value set to 'JWT'.
entry.suggestion: Modify the code and set the JOSE 'cty' protected header value to 'JWT'.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_multi_signatures
entry.text: Invalid JWT because of multiple (%1$d) signatures are found on the JWT.
entry.description: A JWT can only have one signature. The JWT is not a valid JWT.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWT is a valid JWT.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_claim_not_json
entry.text: JWT decoding operation failed, because the claim (%1$s) is not a JSON.
entry.description: A JWT claim must be a JSON.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the data is a valid JWT. Note that the corresponding 'verify' and 'decrypt' actions have been applied to the JWT before the decoding operation.

entry.name: jwt_expired
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the JWT has expired at %1$s.
entry.description: The JWT claim has expired.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWT claim is not expired.

entry.name: jwt_prematured
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the JWT can not be used before %1$s.
entry.description: The JWT claim can not be used before the specified time.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWT claim can not be used before the specified time.

entry.name: jwt_decode_op_data_mismatch
entry.text: Cannot '%1$s' the received JWT.
entry.description: The configuration cannot verify or decrypt the received JWT.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the configuration has matching operation to verify or decrypt the received JWT. To verify a JWS, ensure that verification settings are defined. To decrypt a JWE, ensure that decryption settings are defined.

entry.name: incorrect_jwt_validate_type
entry.text: Incorrect JWT validate type detected on the JWT validate option. Property name: '%1$s'. Expected type: %2$s. Actual type: %3$s.
entry.description: The JWT validation option property is not the expected data type.
entry.suggestion: Use the expected data type to the JWT validation option property. You can also perform custom validation in the JWT.decoder() callback.

entry.name: jwt_claim_nomatch
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the validate option does not have a matched '%1$s' claim value.
entry.description: The JWT claim can not be used because the claim value does not match with the validate option.
entry.suggestion: Specify a JWT claim value in the validation option when calling the JWT Decoder addOperation() API that matches with the JWT.

entry.name: jwt_claim_empty
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the JWT does not contain '%1$s' claim.
entry.description: The JWT claim can not be used because it does not have the specified claim.
entry.suggestion: If this JWT is needed, remove the claim from the validate option when calling the JWT Decoder addOperation() API.

entry.name: jwt_invalid
entry.text: The input data is not a valid JWT.
entry.description: Unable to decode the JWT because the input data is not a valid JWT.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the input to new jwt.Decoder(jwt) is a valid JWT.

entry.name: jwt_invalid_miss_alg_none
entry.text: The input data is not a valid unsecured JWT. The 'alg: none' property is missing from the JOSE header.
entry.description: Unable to decode the JWT because the input data is not a valid JWT.
entry.suggestion: An unsecured JWT must have the 'alg: none' property defined in the JOSE header. Verify that the JWT issuer amends the property.

entry.name: jwt_can_not_decode_jwe
entry.text: The data is encrypted using JWE and can not be decoded before decrypt.
entry.description: The data is encrypted using JWE and can not be decoded before decryption.
entry.suggestion: Add the 'decrypt' operation to the JWT Decoder to decrypt the JWT before decoding the JWT.

entry.name: not_nested_jwt
entry.text: The data is not a nested JWT because it does not have 'cty: JWT' header.
entry.description: Excessive 'verify' or 'decrypt' operations are added to the JWT Decoder. The input JWT data does not have the matched nested JWT structure or the 'cty: JWT' header is missing from the JWT JOSE header.
entry.suggestion: Modify the code and remove excessive 'verify' and 'decrypt' operations from the JWT Decoder.

entry.name: jwk_parameter_failed
entry.text: Failed to decode one of the JWK parameters: %1$s
entry.description: Failed to decode one of the JWK parameters.
entry.suggestion: Verify the parameter value and call the API again.

entry.name: invalid_jwk_missing_required_member
entry.text: Invalid JWK: The member '%1$s' is mandatory
entry.description: A mandatory member of the JWK is required.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: invalid_jwk_member_datatype_wrong
entry.text: Invalid JWK: The data type of the member '%1$s' is not '%2$s'
entry.description: The data type of the JWK member is incorrect.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: invalid_jwk_duplicate_value
entry.text: Invalid JWK: There are duplicate values '%1$s' in the member '%2$s'
entry.description: There are duplicate values in the JWK member
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: invalid_jwkset_missing_required_member
entry.text: Invalid JWK Set: The member '%1$s' is mandatory
entry.description: The mandatory member of the JWK Set is required.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK Set object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_unsupported_kty
entry.text: The JWK object that contains the '%1$s' value of the 'kty' member is not supported
entry.description: The JWK object is not supported.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the JWK object is supported.

entry.name: jwk_invalid_symmetric_key
entry.text: Failed to interpret the JWK object as a symmetric key
entry.description: Failed to interpret the JWK object as a symmetric key.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jose_invalid_document
entry.text: The '%1$d' parameter of method '%2$s' is not a valid '%3%s' object
entry.description: The specified parameter is an invalid object.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the content of the specified parameter is in valid format.

entry.name: jwk_encrypt_key_unsupported_type
entry.text: The key type '%1$s' is not supported
entry.description: The key type is not supported.
entry.suggestion: Verify the key type and call the API again.

entry.name: jose_implicitly_add_cty_header
entry.text: Added a 'cty=%1$s' JOSE Header automatically
entry.description: A 'cty' JOSE Header was added automatically.

entry.name: jose_unsupported_serialization
entry.text: The specified serialization '%1$s' is not supported
entry.description: The specified serialization is not supported.
entry.suggestion: Verify the serialization and call the API again.

entry.name: invalid_jwk_invalid_json
entry.text: Not a valid JSON object
entry.description: Not a valid JSON object.
entry.suggestion: Verify the document and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_invalid_rsa_private_key
entry.text: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an RSA private key
entry.description: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an RSA private key.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_invalid_rsa_public_key
entry.text: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an RSA public key
entry.description: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an RSA public key.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_no_kid_jose_header
entry.text: No 'kid' JOSE Header present in the JWE payload. Failed to correlate a JWK in the JWK Set
entry.description: No 'kid' JOSE Header present. Failed correlate a JWK in the JWK Set
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWE object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_no_proper_jwk_in_jwkset
entry.text: Failed to find a proper JWK in the JWK Set
entry.description: Failed to find a proper JWK in the JWK Set
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_not_supported_crv
entry.text: The value of 'crv' member '%1$s' is not supported
entry.description: The value of 'crv' member is not supported.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_invalid_key_length
entry.text: The octet length of '%1$s' member is incorrect
entry.description: The octet length of one member is incorrect.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwe_json_serialization_no_recipient
entry.text: JWE JSON Serialization needs at least one recipient or alternatively use Direct Encryption
entry.description: JWE JSON Serialization needs at least one recipient or alternatively use Direct Encryption.
entry.suggestion: Add at least one recipient or alternatively use Direct Encryption.

entry.name: jwk_key_export_not_allowed
entry.text: Using the key material '%1$s' in the calling API is not allowed
entry.description: Using a Crypto Key, Crypto Certificate or Crypto Shared Secret Key in the calling API is not allowed.
entry.suggestion: Verify that your key material is supported and call the API again.

entry.name: jws_alg_none_with_signature
entry.text: If the value of the algorithm is 'none', the payload cannot contain a signature
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the payload contains a signature.

entry.name: jws_alg_none_with_key
entry.text: If the value of the algorithm is 'none', do not set a value for the key
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Remove any API that is used to set the key.

entry.name: jwt_invalid_iss
entry.text: JWT validation failed, 'iss' (issuer) claim does not match.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: not_supported_type
entry.text: JWT library does not support this data type for claim validation.
entry.description: Only primitive data type, string, number, and boolean are supported.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the data type is supported.

entry.name: jwt_claim_invalid
entry.text: Claim, '%1$s', does not match.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: jwt_no_iss
entry.text: Missing iss claim.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: jws_jsonflat_single_header
entry.text: The sign operation failed with multiple JWSHeaders
entry.description: The sign operation failed with multiple JWSHeaders. The JWS JSON flattened serialization supports only a single Protected Header.
entry.suggestion: Call sign() with only a single JWSHeader when the 'json_flat' output is required; otherwise, specify the 'json' output format.

entry.name: jwe_jsonflat_single_recipient
entry.text: The encrypt operation failed with multiple JWEHeader Recipients
entry.description: The encrypt operation failed with multiple JWEHeader Recipients. The JWE JSON flattened serialization supports only a single JWEHeader Recipient.
entry.suggestion: Call encrypt() with only a single JWEHeader Recipient when the 'json_flat' output is required; otherwise, specify the 'json' output format.

entry.name: jws_verify_alg_mismatch
entry.text: Invalid alg value %1$s for %2$s
entry.description: The valid algorithm list for JWS signature verification did not include the received JWS alg header value.
entry.suggestion: This might indicate message-tampering. Investigate the problem.

entry.name: jws_verify_alg_type_mismatch
entry.text: The %1$s algorithm is not valid with the specified key material type of '%2$s'
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the algorithm is valid with the specified key material type.

entry.name: jwk_invalid_ec_private_key
entry.text: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an EC private key
entry.description: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an EC private key.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_invalid_ec_public_key
entry.text: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an EC public key
entry.description: Failed to interpret the JWK object as an EC public key.
entry.suggestion: Verify the JWK object and call the API again.

entry.name: jwk_not_match
entry.text: The JWK specified in the message does not match to the configured key
entry.description: See message text

entry.name: cannot_fetch_jwt
entry.text: An error occurred.The action cannot find the JWT in the specified context variable.
entry.description: see message text
entry.suggestion: Ensure the specified context variable is valid.

entry.name: cannot_parse_jwt
entry.text: An error occurred.The action cannot parse the JWT in the specified context variable.
entry.description: see message text
entry.suggestion: Ensure the JWT is valid.

entry.name: not_unsecured_jwt
entry.text: Received an encrypted or signed JWT but no key material is defined in the action to decrypt or verify the JWT.
entry.description: see message text
entry.suggestion: Ensure the configuration in JWT validate action is valid.

entry.name: jwt_require_decrypt_but_invalid_alg
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the invalid alg parameter %1$s.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: jwt_require_decrypt_but_invalid_enc
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the enc parameter %1$s is invalid.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: jwt_require_decrypt_but_no_enc
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because the enc parameter is empty.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: jwt_keyusage_mismatch
entry.text: JWT validation failed, because usage of key material is mismatch.
entry.description: See message text.

entry.name: jwt_generate_missing_property
entry.text: JWT generation failed, because the required configuration '%1$s' is missing when '%2$s' the JWT.
entry.description: The required configuration is missing when signing or encrypting the JWT.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that you provide the required settings. To sign a JWT, you must specify these settings: 1. a JWK or a cryptographic object; 2. the cryptographic algorithm. To encrypt a JWT, you must specify these settings: 1. a JWK or a cryptographic object; 2. the encrypt algorithm; 3. the key encrypt algorithm.

entry.name: incorrect_key_length_2
entry.text: When using the '%1$s' algorithm, the key length should be at least %2$lu bits
entry.description: The algorithm used requires an adequate key length in bits.
entry.suggestion: Use the correct key length for selected algorithm.

entry.name: jws_header_param_b64
entry.text: The JWS header b64 must be integrity protected, included in the 'crit' list, and have a consistent boolean value
entry.description: The JWS header b64 must be integrity protected, included in the 'crit' list, and have a consistent boolean value for all protected header instances.
entry.suggestion: Use the correct specification for the 'b64' JWS header, and include it in the 'crit' header.
